She has three years experience in this line of work and is requesting a loan to buy a new sewing machine and other equipment. Mary hopes to use the additional profit she expects to earn to expand her business and improve her house. She joined SPBD in 2011 as a way to access financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and other equipment.

loans.name: Faaua

texts.en:
Faaua is 50 years old and married with four children. She wants to start a small business making and selling pancakes in her community.

Faaua joined SPBD this year to apply for a 1000 WST loan to buy flour, sugar, oil and kitchen utensils to start out. Faaua is determined to see her business thrive.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, oil and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy supplies for a beauty salon.

loans.name: Saoleagasitasia

texts.en: Saoleagasitasia  is 35 years old, married and has seven children. She wants to start a small business making and selling crafts, fine mats, necklaces, hand fans and others items to people in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy a carving machine, rolls of sandpaper and other small tools. In the future, Saoleagasitasia hopes to produce more products and provide the best quality crafts available in her area. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to start a small crafts business.

loans.name: Milagro Gregoria

texts.es:
Milagro, tiene 38 años de edad, tiene dos hijos uno de 15 años y el otro de 5 años, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde hace siete años, dedicándose a este negocio con la ayuda de una hija con quien realizan la venta.

Solicita un préstamo para realizar la compra el maíz, leña, comal, que son los necesarios para que pueda realizar la produccion de las tortillas e incrementar sus ganancias, manteniendo todo lo necesario a su alcance.

Su aspiración es fortalecer el negocio, todo a través de esta ayuda de los préstamos, ya que le permitirá mejorar sus ventas y la calidad de vida con los ingresos a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Milagro is 38 years old. She has two children; one is 15 and the other is 5. She has been selling tortillas for seven years. She has dedicated herself to the business with the help of her daughter, who makes the sales.

She is requesting a loan for the purchase of corn, firewood and comal (flat earthenware griddle for cooking tortillas), which are the necessities for the production of tortillas and increasing her profits, keeping everything she needs within reach.

Her aim is to strengthen the business, all through the aid of loans, and that will allow her to improve sales and quality of life with the income to her children.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, griddle.

loans.name: Angel Vicente

texts.es:
Angel tiene 40 años de edad es casado tiene siete hijos. vive con la esposa y con los hijos en el cantón Ventanas provincia de los ríos. 

Es integranbte de la VRC 27 DE OCTUBR, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Santa Sofía, Perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, Esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol gandul.

Angel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en ventanas. 

Solicita el crédito para comprar abonos, urea, fertilizantes, líquidos y seguir trabajando en la agricultura.
 Con el apoyo del crédito podrá comprar los insumos.

Los deasfíos a los que se enfrentya son las plagas y la variedad del clima.
En el tiempo libre le gusta practicar el deporte.
texts.en:
Angel is 40 years old. He is married and has seven children. He lives with his wife and children in Ventanas canton in Los Ríos province.

He is a member of the 27 de Octubre (October 27th) communal bank, located in the Santa Sofía precinct, Ventanas canton. The members of this communal bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice, and pigeon peas.

Angel is a farmer, and he grows corn. He buys and sells in Ventanas.

He is asking for the loan to buy manure, urea, fertilizer, and liquid supplies, and to continue working in agriculture. With the help of the loan, he will be able to buy supplies.

The challenges he faces are infestations and variations in climate.

In his free time he likes to play sports.

loans.use: to purchase manure, urea, fertilizer, and liquid supplies, and to continue working in agriculture.

loans.name: Uigess

texts.en:
Uigess is 26 years old and married with three children. She has a small garden where she grows taro that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for four years. 

Uigess needs a loan to purchase bags of fertilizers, weed killer, bush knives, etc. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. Uigess will use the profits from her sales to increase the quality of her garden and also provide good financial support for her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizers, weed killer, bush knives, etc.

loans.name: Rita Del Carmen

texts.es:
Rita tiene 43 años de edad es casada tiene tres hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos en el cantón ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es integranbte de la VRC 27 DE OCTUBR, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Santa Sofía, Perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, Esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol gandul.

Rita se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y frejol gandúl. Las compras y las ventas lo ahace en ventanas. 

Solicita el crédito para  comprar semillas, fertilizantes, urea, líquidos.Con la ayuda del crédito podra comprar los abonos agricolas para poder trabajar en la agricultura. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas.

El sueño es poder tener casa propia y terrenos.
texts.en:
Rita is 43 years old, married and has three children. She lives with her husband and children in Ventanas canton in Los Rios Province. She is a member of the 27 de Octubre Communal Bank, which is located in Santa Sofia precinct, belonging to Ventanas canton. This bank is involved in short cycle farming of maize, rice and pigeon pea beans.

Rita cultivates maize and pigeon pea beans. She makes her purchases and sales in Ventanas. She is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, urea and liquids. With the help of the loan she will be able to buy the agricultural composts to be able to work her land. The challenges she faces include pest infestations.

She dreams of being able to own her own house and lands.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, urea and liquids.

loans.name: Jose Saul

texts.es:
Jose, vive con su familia, tiene dos hijos, José tiene 52 años de edad, vive con su esposa y se dedica a la fotografía y filme de videos, el negocio lo tiene en su vivienda y trabaja con las escuelas y en eventos sociales.

El Esta solicitando un préstamo para utilizarlo en la compra de papel fotográfico y la reparación de una cámara, este préstamo le brindara lo necesario, con el recurso económico para que pueda incrementar en materiales en la foto estudio y así también mantener en buenas condiciones las cámaras.

Su objetivo es mejorar el negocio para poder crecer y superarse con Su familia, ofreciendo a sus familiares la mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: José lives with his family; he has two children.  José is 52-years-old and lives with his wife.  He works in photography and videography.  His business is located at home and he works with schools and in social events.  He’s asking for a loan to buy photographic paper and to repair a camera.  This loan will provide him with what he needs; he’ll have the economic resources to increase his photo studio stock as well as to have his cameras in good operating condition.  Is goal is to improve the business in order to be able to grow and get ahead with his family offering them a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy photographic paper and to repair a camera.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a buffalo.

loans.name: Jesus Herminio

texts.es:
Jesús, se dedica a la venta de verduras, tiene 42 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos uno de ellos tiene 12 años y el otro tiene 10, los dos están estudiando, y se dedica a la compra de verdura a los agricultores y la vende en un mercado por mayor, este negocio lo aprendió con sus patronos anteriores.

Solicita un préstamo para tener la disponibilidad económica y realizar la compra de pipianes y pepinos al por mayor, comprándoselas siempre los pequeños agricultores, esta inversión le ayudara a mejorar su inventario y continuar trabajando por su desarrollo económico en la familia.

Su aspiración es fortalecer más el negocio y ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida sus hijos, a través de la buena administración de los préstamos.
texts.en: Jesús, 42, sells vegetables.  He lives with his wife and two children; one of them is 12-years-old and the other one is 10. Both are attending school.  He buys vegetables from farmers and sells them in a market at wholesale.  He learned this business from his former bosses.  He’s asking for a loan in order to have economic wherewithal to buy squash and cucumbers at wholesale from small farmers.  This investment will help him improve his inventory and to continue working towards his family’s economic development.  His hope is to strengthen the business more and to offer his children a better quality of life by means of well-managed loans.

loans.use: to buy squash and cucumbers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy electrical repair tools and electrical supplies.

loans.name: Eseese

texts.en: Eseese is a 32-year-old married woman with four children. She catches and sells fish in her community to earn a living. She has three years of experience with this business. Eseese needs a loan to purchase new fishing nets to help her maintain her business in steady condition. She plans to use her profits to be able to support her family and also her children in school. Eseese has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, a spear, and a new canoe.

loans.name: Famy

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de hotel,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m.la socia tambien administra el hotel la socia ya lleva 8 años en este negocio,la socia por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de hotel.La socia solicita el credito para comprar sabanas,colchas y frazadas para implementar el hotel

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: She continues in the hotel business.  She works from 8am until 6pm and also manages the hotel.  She’s been in business 8 years and wants to move her children forward by means of this business.  Her dream is to expand the hotel business.   She’s asking for the loan to buy sheets, bedspreads and blankets to equip the hotel.  She’s happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to bujy sheets, bedspreads and blankets to equip the hotel.

loans.name: Jonny Narciso

texts.es:
Jonny, se dedica a la venta de lubricantes, de teléfonos celulares y recargas telefónicas, el vive con su familia, tiene dos hijos uno de 8 años y el otro de 3 años de edad, el negocio lo inicio a base de créditos y de esfuerzo personal, ha logrado crecer en clientes, están motivado por continuar esforzándose por estabilizar el negocio.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de lubricantes, también comprará accesorios para teléfonos celulares, el préstamo será de mucha ayuda para que continúe mejorando la atencion a sus clientes y las ventas.

Su objetivo es poder desarrollarse más en el mercado, generar una mejor condición económica para su familia y que sus hijos sientan su apoyo para superarse.
texts.en: Jonny works selling lubricants, mobile phones and phone recharges.  He lives with his family; he has two children, an 8-year-old and a 3-year-old.  He started the business with loans and his own efforts.  He’s managed to expand his customer base and is motivated to continue stabilizing the business.  He’s asking for a loan to buy lubricants and to also buy mobile phone accessories.  The loan will be very useful in order to continue providing customer service and making sales.  His goal is to develop more in the marketplace, to generate a better economic situation for his family and that his children feel his support so they can get ahead.

loans.use: to buy lubricants and mobile phone accessories.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan, se dedica a atender un negocio de productos domesticos, vive con su esposa, tienen dos hijos,  el inicio el negocio por iniciativa propia , su ventaja es la ubicación que le permite tener mejores demandas.

Solicita un préstamo para poder mejorar el negocio con la disponibilidad de productos en la tienda como frijoles, arroz, gaseosas, algunas medicinas, queso, éste le permitirá aumentar el inventario que tiene a la orden de los clientes.

Su objetivo con el préstamo es continuar progresando a través del negocio y lograr  ofrecer a su familia una mejor condición de vida.
texts.en: Juan runs a grocery store where he sells home products.  He lives with his wife and they have two children.   He started the business on his own initiative.  His advantage is location for he has high demand.  He’s asking for a loan to improve the business by having more products available like beans, rice, soft-drinks, some medicines and cheese.  This will allow him to increase inventory available for customers.  His goal for the loan is to continue progressing through his business and succeed in offering his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, soft-drinks, some medicines and cheese.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Sinta

texts.en:
Sinta is 24 years old and single with no children. She has a small garden, where she grows taros that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. Sinta needs a loan to help her buy what she needs to develop her farm into good condition (weed killer, weed sprayer, fertilizer, bush knives, etc.). She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. 

Sinta will use the profits from her sales to help solve her family financial problems and be able to improve their home condition.

loans.use: to purchase weed killer, weed sprayer, fertilizer, and bush knives.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and buy clothes in bulk for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fresh seasonal fruits to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy an electric sewing machine that will help her to stich cloth in less time.

loans.name: Emanuel Group

texts.es:
El comité Emanuel se encuentra en su 3er ciclo, esta conformado por mujeres que viven en el mismo barrio. El comité se caracteriza por la solidaridad, todas ellas realizan actividades para recaudar fondos,se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común que todas tienen dentro del grupo.
La señora Esmilda es manicurista y ya cuenta con su clientela semanal a quienes les brinda el mejor servicio posible para poder tener mayor clientela, con esta actividad ella genera ingresos y así aporta a la canasta familiar.
El crédito solicitado sería para cubrir los gastos como los esmaltes, toallas y los instrumentos que utiliza.
texts.en:
The “Emanuel” committee is in its 3rd cycle.  It’s composed of women who live in the same neighborhood.  It’s noted for its solidarity.  They all carry out fund-raising activities and help each other out in order to reach the common goals they have as a group.  

Esmilda is a manicurist and she has a regular, weekly clientele that she provides the best possible service to in order to have even more customers.  She generates income with this activity to contribute towards family’s basic needs.  The requested loan will be used to cover costs of nail polish, towels and tools she uses.

loans.use: to buy manicure supplies like towels and nail polish.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase jewelry making material, beats, artificial spheres, metal, etc., in large quantities.

loans.name: Delmy Jeannette

texts.es:
Delmy, vive con su familia, tiene 19 años de edad, es madre soltera de un niño de tres meses de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de comida y pupusas, lo aprendió a través de su tía y tiene tres años de estar realizándolo, a través de este negocio estará mejorando sus ingresos para solventar las necesidades con su hijo.

Solicita un préstamo para comprarse carne, tomates, frijoles, repollo, quesillo, gas, y otros materiales que son necesarias para continuar realizando el negocio,esto le dara un negocio estable, mejoras en sus ventas y  sus ingresos.

El objetivo de ella es a través del préstamo poder fortalecer el negocio y aumentar la capacidad en sus ventas, ya que seria una fuente de ingresos para poder tener el recurso económico para su hijo.
texts.en: Delmy lives with her family and is 19 years old. She is a single mother of a 3-month-old son. She engages in the sale of food and pupusas, a business she learned from her aunt. She has had this business for three years and through it she has been increasing her income to support the needs of her son. She is requesting a loan to purchase meat, tomatoes, beans, cabbage, cheese, gas and other materials necessary to continue with her business. This will stabilize her business and improve her sales and income. Her objective through the loan is to be able to strengthen her business and increase her volume of sales since they will be a source of income that will enable her to have the financial resources for her son.

loans.use: to buy meat, tomatoes, beans, cabbage, cheese and gas.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
El Señor Tomas se dedica a realizar servicios de gestiones en distintas entidades públicas y privadas, presta dicho servicio a las personas que carecen de tiempo para realizar sus gestiones por sí mismas.Tomas ya es un conocido gestor en su ambiente y cuenta con una importante red de clientes que solicitan sus servicios.
El crédito obtenido lo  ha invertido en compra de carbón, pues en paralelo a sus actividades normales, Tomas esta instalando un local de venta de carbón.
Con este nuevo crédito el señor va a poder  ampliar sus actividades emprendidas con  nuevos negocios y a la vez va a poder acercarse de manera mas rápida a los objetivos que se propone como microempresario; dichos objetivos son brindar cada día mejor servicio y llegar a mas cantidad de personas.
texts.en:
Tomas works carrying out various bureaucratic transactions in various public and private entities; he does these services for people who don’t have time for such things themselves.  Tomas is a well-known facilitator in his environment and has an important network of customers who request his services.  He will use the loan to buy charcoal since this is an activity he runs alongside his normal activities.  Tomas is setting up a charcoal vending site.

With this new loan he will be able to expand his activities with new businesses and at the same time be able to get closer to the goals he’s set for himself as a micro businessman more quickly.  Said goals are to provide better service every day and to reach a larger number of people.

loans.use: to buy charcoal.

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en:
Rashid lives in the Malindi area of Coast Province, Kenya. He has five children, all of whom attend school. He owns a retail shop selling sandals, a business that he has been operating for five years.

He learned about Milango through friends who invited him to the group and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenges are taxes and lack of enough funds.

Rashid is applying for a loan of 83,450 Kenya shillings to buy materials for the making of the sandals. His extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to buy basic needs and improve on the living standard of his family. 

His dream is to sell at wholesale and become a supplier of sandals in the area.

loans.use: to buy materials for the making of the sandals.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix lives in the Malindi area of Coast Province, Kenya. He has 11 children; 10 of his children attend school. He owns a hardware shop where he sells building materials, a business that he has been operating for 22 years.

He learned about Milango through friends who invited him to the group, and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenges are transport and fuel costs and high taxes.

Felix is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings to buy hardcore (crushed brick rubble) and bricks for the business. His extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to pay school fees, meet basic needs and improve the living standards of his family. His dream is to expand the business.

loans.use: To buy hardcore (crushed brick rubble) and bricks for the business.

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.es:
Cesar tiene 36 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con el papá en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integranbte de la VRC 27 DE OCTUBRE, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Santa Sofía, Perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, Esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol gandul.

Cesar se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de máiz. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en ventanas.
Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos, fertilizantes, urea, líquidos.Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los abonos agrícolas.
Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas. El sueño es poder seguir trabajando en la agricultura para poder sobrevivir.

En el tiempo libre le gusta trabajar aparte de la labor normal.
texts.en:
Cesar, 36, is single and has no children.  He lives with his father in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.  He’s a member of the “27 de Octubre” communal bank located in Recinto Santa Sofía that’s part of Ventanas Canton.  This communal bank is involved with agricultural activities related to short cycle corn, rice and pigeon pea farming.

He grows corn.  His purchases and his sales take place in Ventanas.  He’s asking for the loan to buy supplies, fertilizer, urea and liquids.  With help from the loan he will be able to buy agricultural manure.  The challenge he faces is plant infestations.  His dream is to be able to continue working in agriculture in order to survive.  In his free time he enjoys doing work that’s different from his normal work.

loans.use: to buy supplies, fertilizers, urea, and liquid fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a collection of mobile phones for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for her husband's agriculture business.

loans.name: Virgen Del Rosario Group

texts.es:
El comité Virgen del Rosario esta constituido con 13 señoras que viven en la misma comunidad. El comité se caracteriza por ser muy unido siempre, se ayudan entre las integrantes y en las micro empresas que realizan, generalmente realizan actividades para generar un fondo común que hace aumentar los ingresos.
Una integrante del comité, la señora María, es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de productos relacionados a la venta de alimentos como carnes, lácteos, frutas y verduras entre otros alimentos. 
El crédito solicitado sería para comprar mercaderías y también para volver a re invertir en el negocio.
texts.en:
The “Virgen del Rosario” committee has 13 members who live in the same community.  The committee is noted for being united always; they help each other out with their various micro businesses.  They generally carry out fund-raising activities to generate group funds to increase their income.

One of the group members is María.  She’s a merchant who sells all types of food items like meats, dairy products, fruit and vegetables among other foods.  The requested loan will be used to buy merchandise and also to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to buy food products like meat, dairy products, fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Jacinto Patricio

texts.es:
Jacinto tiene 25 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC 27 DE OCTUBRE, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Santa Sofía, Perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, Esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol gandul.

Se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de máiz. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en ventanas.
Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos, fertilizantes, urea, líquidos.Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los abonos agrícolas.
Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas. El sueño es poder seguir trabajando para poder comprar mas terrenos

en los tiempos libres le gusta cuidar a los animales
texts.en:
Jacinto, 25, is single and has no children.  He lives with his parents in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.  He’s a member of the “27 de Octubre” communal bank located in Recinto Santa Sofía that’s part of Ventanas Canton.  This communal bank is involved with agricultural activities related to short cycle corn, rice and pigeon pea farming.

He grows corn.  His purchases and his sales take place in Ventanas.  He’s asking for the loan to buy supplies, fertilizer, urea and liquids.  With help from the loan he will be able to buy agricultural manure.  The challenge he faces is plant infestations.  His dream is to be able to continue working to be able to buy more land.  He likes caring for the animals in his free time.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy leather, shoe polish and nails for her husband's shoe-making business.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a resident of Malindi of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has two children. She owns a retail shop, a business that she has been operating for three years.

She learned about Milango through a friend who invited her to the group and she joined with an aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenge is a low seasonal market.

Esther is applying for a loan of 83,500 Kenya shillings to purchase retail stock, cereals, and maize flour. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to pay school fees for her children. She aspires to open other retail shops in other areas in the future.

loans.use: to buy retail stock, cereals, and maize flour.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El comité Maria Auxiliadora esta conformado por 15 integrantes mujeres muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras. El comité siempre se ha comprometido con la fundación de forma responsable y emprendedora.
La señora María se encarga de realizar ventas varias, es decir vende todo tipo de productos de forma ambulante, como ser alimentos, sábanas, telas, etc. con esta actividad ella aporta ingresos económicos a su familia.
El crédito sería para comprar todo tipo de mercaderías necesarias para que el negocio continue y siga creciendo la clientela.
texts.en:
The Maria Auxiliadora committee is made up of 15 hard-working and entrepreneurial women.  This committee has always behaved responsibly and professionally with the Foundation.

Maria sells various items as a street merchant, such as food, sheets, cloth, etc.  This business has helped her with the economic situation of her family.

She will use the loan to buy all types of needed merchandise for her business so that it can continue and she is able to attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy food, sheets, towels, etc

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Abeer

texts.en:
Abeer is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her son, Mohammad, who is over 18 years old, appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Abeer is a 46-year-old woman, who is married and a mother to two sons and two daughters. Her husband is a worker who gets a low salary that is not enough to cover the family's needs.

Abeer is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the cost of making some necessary repairs to her house, such as painting and purchasing new living room furniture, in order to improve living conditions in her house. Taking this loan will offer to Abeer and her family comfortable furniture and suitable home conditions so they can enjoy living in their house.

loans.use: to make necessary repairs to her house and to purchase living room furniture.

loans.name: Josephine Flavie

texts.fr: Josephine est une femme agée de de 38 ans, mariée, mère de 5 enfants, tous sont scolarirés. Elle commerçante dans un marché de la capitale ou elle commercialise les vêtements, sacs et bijoux depuis 10 ans. Suite à l'augmentation de la demande, elle solicite un crédit pour y faire face en augmentant  le stock pour éviter les ruptures permanentes. ceci satisfera sa clientèle, l'évitera de se tourner vers la conccurence et augmentera ses ventes et donc sa marge bénéficiaire. Les bénéfices générés par ce crédit seront en partieréinvestir dans son activité pou l'aggrandir, et le reste lui permettra d'aider son époux à résoudre certains problèmes quotidiens.
texts.en:
Josephine, age 38, is a married mother of five children who all go to school. She has been selling clothing, bags and jewelery for the past 10 years at a market of the capital. 

To meet customer demand, she is seeking a loan to stock up on merchandise and avoid permanent shortages. This will help her to meet the needs of her customers and keep them from going to competitors. It will also bolster her sales and profits. 

She plans to use part of the profits to reinvest in her business by expanding her activity. Any remainder will help her husband to handle various daily responsibilities.

loans.use: to increase her stock of clothing, bags and jewelery for sale.

loans.name: Dany José

texts.es:
Don Dany, es originario del municipio de Nindirí del departamento de Masaya, tiene la edad de 33 años, de oficio comerciante, su núcleo familiar es de 4 el,  sus dos hijos menores de edad y su esposa. Anteriormente el trabajaba como jardinero y chofer,  pero su salario era muy poco, aparte que le dedicaba poco tiempo a sus hijos porque había días que salía muy noche del trabajo y nos los veía. 
Se vio en la necesidad de  emprender su propio negocio en donde pudiera darles una mejor atención a sus hijos y  una buena educación, actualmente tiene 6 años su negocio y ve que a ido prosperando, este consiste en compra y venta de calzado de segunda, lo tiene ubicado en  uno de los  mercado de Jinotepe, el vende de forma ambulante ya tiene sus clientes que les compran ya que solo llega a distribuir los pedidos que a el le encargan. Tiene su propia clientela y se siente satisfecho del progreso que a tenido porque dice que su esfuerzo a valido la pena, ya que a mejorado su calidad de vida y le esta dando una mejor comodidad a su familia. 
Se presenta a nuestras oficinas Ceprodel para solicitar un préstamo que le permita comprar la mercadería que esta requiriendo como zapatos mixtos, bota de trabajo, mamulón mixto. Para cumplirle con la mayor rapidez a su cliente ya que con lo que tiene no le da abasto, y poder tener más utilidades en su negocio.
texts.en:
Don Dany is originally from the town of Nindirí in the Department of Masaya. He is 33 years old and a merchant by trade. His family consists of four individuals: himself, his two young children, and his wife. Dany previously worked as a gardener and chauffeur, but his salary was very low. In addition, he has been able to spend little time with his children because on most days he arrives home from work very late at night.

Dany saw the need to start his own business so that he could provide better care of his children and give them a good education. He has now been in business for six years and is prospering. Dany buys and sells secondhand shoes at one of the markets in Jinotepe. He is a traveling merchant and already has customers who only buy from him when he delivers the orders they have placed. Dany has his own clientele and feels satisfied with the progress he has made since all of his efforts have been rewarded. He has been able to improve his quality of life and provide more comfortable conditions for his family.

Dany came to the offices of CEPRODEL to request a loan so that he could buy merchandise such as a variety of shoes, work boots, and a mix of oversized goods. Since he does not have inventory, Dany will now be able to fulfill his customers’ orders more quickly and earn more profits for his business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of shoes, work boots, and a mix of oversized goods.

loans.name: Jorge Washington

texts.es:
Jorge Washington tiene 27 años, es casado vive con la esposa y con los hijos. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama VRC SAN FRANCISCO DE SIBIMBE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Sibimbe, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta  ventanilla tiene 20socio los cuales se dedican a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembran maíz y arroz.

Jorge Washington se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz, además se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y gallinas. Las compra y la ventas de los productos agrícolas las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, insecticidas, ranger, líquido mata maleza. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir necesidades. El sueño es sembrar 5 héctareas de terrenos.

En el tiempo libre le gusta salir hacer deporte con la familia y amogos.
texts.en:
George Washington is 27 years old, married and he lives with his wife and children. He lives in the Ventanas Cantón in the Province of Los Rios.
His community bank is called VRC San Francisco de Sibimbe, which is located in Recinto Sibimbe, which belongs to the Ventanas Cantón. The community bank has 20 members who are mainly farmers. In their short growing season they grow corn and rice.
George Washington is a farmer who grows corn and rice. He also raises pigs and chickens. He buys and sells his agricultural products in the town of Ventanas each month and he also sells his goods in a market in the same town.
He is asking for this loan in order to buy seeds, insecticides, ranger (pesticide) and weed killer. With the help of this loan he can buy needed items. His dream is to cultivate 5 hectacres of land.
In his free time he likes to play sports with his family and friends.

loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticides, pesticides (ranger) and weed killer.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine's business has witnessed much growth from the first loan she received. Besides, the sales have also improved. 

She is applying for this loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to purchase salon items and stock.

loans.use: to buy salon supplies.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en: Teresia owns a fruit parlor in Mombasa, Kenya. She saved money and opened the business in her house before opening a fruit parlor. She is married and has one child. The fruit parlor has been in operation for two years. She is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenyan shillings to purchase a fruit processing machine. Teresia will use the extra income to purchase additional stock, and she has also fixed her eyes on opening other types of businesses.

loans.use: to purchase a fruit processing machine.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en: Mohamed is more than grateful for the support he received from his first loan used to improve his business. His sales improved and he is now applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to purchase additional stock of coconuts to sell

loans.use: To purchase more coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: Khady est une femme mariée et mère de trois enfants.Elle tient un commerce de produits cosmétiques. Elle a également un taxi de transport urbain qui lui permet d'augmenter ses revenus journaliers et de faire face aux dépenses d'entretien de  sa famille.Toutefois, ce taxi est tombé en panne il y a un mois.Afin de le réparer et remettre en circulation, il sollicite un pret de 400000f pour acheter un nouveau moteur.
texts.en: Khady is a married mother of three children. She sells cosmetic products, and she also runs a city taxi service that helps to bolster her daily revenue and provide for her family’s needs. Unfortunately, her taxi broke down a month ago. To get it repaired and put it back to work, she is seeking a loan of 400,000f to buy a new engine.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fishing nets.

loans.name: Fidelia

texts.es:
Fidelia, tiene 68 años de edad, vive con sus dos hijos, los cuales trabajan y le ayuda económicamente, ella administra una tienda de productos domésticos, le gusta mantenerla bien surtida de mercaderías y existe desde hace 10 años, hasta el momento ha logrado ganar un buen número de clientes.

Ella solicita un préstamo para utilizarlo en la compra de agua embotellada, embutidos, gaseosas, gas, esta compra le permitiera incrementar el inventario y poder mejorar la disponibilidad sus clientes.

Su objetivo es fortalecerse a través de los préstamos, desarrollar el negocio y poder mejorar los ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Fidelia is 68 years old and lives with her two children. The children work and help her financially. Fidelia has a store where she sells household items. She likes to maintain a good variety of goods in her store. She has had the store for ten years. Up until the present, she has had a good number of customers.
She is asking for this loan in order to buy bottled water, sausages, sodas, and propane. These purchases will allow her to increase her inventory, which will let her meet the needs of her customers.
Her goal is to strengthen her business with this loan, improve her business and improve her income so that she has a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy bottled water, sausages, sodas and propane.

loans.name: Jose David

texts.es:
José, Esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo, pues su intención es mantenerse en el negocio con un buen nivel de mercadería para atender las demandas de los clientes, se comprara una variedad de prendas de oro entre ellas aretes, collares, cadenas, pulseras, ya que aumentará la variedad y éste le permitiera atender mejor los gustos de los clientes.

Con el préstamo anterior manifiesta que la inversión le permitió tener una variedad de mercadería para poder vender, su negocio ha tenido una mayor capacidad para atender la demanda de los clientes y al mismo tiempo en este periodo considera haber tenido una solvencia económica frente a sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
José is asking for a new loan. His goals for this loan are to keep his business well stocked in order to meet the needs of his customers. He will buy a variety of gold items such as earrings, necklaces, chains and bracelets. He will increase the variety of his inventory in order to meet the tastes of his customers.
With his last loan he was able to buy a variety of merchandise to sell. His store has a large capacity in order to meet the demands of his customers. At the same time, in this period he would like to be free of financial obligations.

loans.use: to buy earrings, necklaces, chains and bracelets.

loans.name: Viclyntor

texts.en:
Viclyntor is a resident of Kongowea in the Coast province, Kenya. She is married and has three children. She owns a green grocery, a business that she has been operating for one year. 

She learned about Milango through a friend who invited her to the group and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenge is finding customers.

Viclyntor is applying for a loan of 4,150 Kenya shillings to purchase fruits, beans, kerosene and fish. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve the living standards of her family. She aspires to open a wholesale grocery shop and become a supplier of her products in future.

loans.use: To purchase fruits, beans, kerosene and fish.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a resident of the Kilifi area of Coast province, Kenya. She is married and has nine children, all of whom attend school. She owns a food cafe, a business that she has been operating for six months. Apart from this, she earns a salary from her transport business.

She learned about Milango through a friend who invited her to the group and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenges are competition and lack of funds.

Alice is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to buy maize flour, wheat flour, cereals and cooking oil. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to increase her income and improve the living standard of her family. She aspires to open a bigger food cafe and start a grocery shop.

loans.use: To buy maize flour, wheat flour, cereals and cooking oil.

loans.name: Fermina Isabel

texts.es: Fermina amplió el surtido de productos como pasteles hayacas y vendió mucho cada fin de semana. Este se lo debe a su credikiva, con el que pudo invertir en materias primas e insumos, en mayor volumen y tener una oferta apropiada a las necesidades de su clientela. Ella da gracias a los financiadores de Kiva, por su préstamo con el cual capitaliza poco a poco su negocio, por eso se prepara en la aplicación de un nuevo credikiva, con el cual invertirá en materias primas como harina, carnes y recipientes plásticos; con su nueva inversión planea su éxito en metas de venta, pues tiene una experiencia que la ampara y que impulsa el crecimiento de su negocio.
texts.en: Fermina expanded her product stock of items like hayaca pies (a pie made with corn flour filled with fish or meat, raisins, olives, almonds, etc.) and has sold many every weekend. This is due to her credikiva with which she can invest in buying raw materials to have a greater quantity of stock and allow her to have sales for her customers. Fermina is thankful to the Kiva lenders for the loan which she used little by little on her business, and is in need of a new credikiva to buy raw materials like flour, meats and plastic containers. Fermina with the new investment plans to be successful in her sales goals since she has experience that will lead and drive to the growth of her business.

loans.use: buy ingredients and supplies for her fast-food items.

loans.name: Mauricio Alfredo

texts.es:
Mauricio, se ha decidido por invertir más en el negocio y para esto solicita un préstamo que le permita invertir en la compra del hierro de diferentes medidas, lámina, electrodos, entre otros materiales que son necesarios en su taller para la elaboración de balcones y puertas, este préstamo continuará brindándole a Mauricio el recurso económico que es tan necesario para invertir en la materia prima.

Le permitió el préstamo anterior todo lo necesario para continuar trabajando y así atendió mejor a los clientes, ha tenido una gran capacidad para poder realizar sus trabajos y su condición económica considera que está cambiando obteniendo nuevos clientes y mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Mauricio has decided to invest further in his business, and for this purpose he is requesting a loan which will allow him to invest in buying iron in various sizes, sheet metal and electrodes, along with other necessary supplies for his workshop where he makes balconies and doors. This loan will continue providing Mauricio with the economic resources which he needs so much in order to invest in raw materials. 

The previous loan allowed him to continue working and thus he was able to better serve his customers. He has had a great ability to carry out his projects. As for his economic condition, he believes that it is changing, as he obtains new customers and better earnings.

loans.use: to buy iron in various sizes, sheet metal and electrodes.

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
Johnson lives in the Kongowea area of Coast province, Kenya. He is married and has five children. He owns a hawking business and sells livestock, a business he has been operating for six years now.

He learned about Milango through a friend who invited him to the group and he joined with the aim of the accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenges are high transport and fuel prices from the farm to the market place, price fluctuations and inflation.

Johnson is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to buy goats, sheep, chickens and cows to sell. His extra income will be added to his savings to pay school fees for his children. He aspires to expand his business to become a large-scale dealer in the livestock-selling business and employ more workers.

loans.use: To  buy goats, sheep, chickens and cows to sell

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en:
Jeremiah is a resident and a farmer in Nkubu, Central Kenya where he lives with his wife and two children who are two and four years old. He has been in farming for 10 years and currently produces cereals like maize and sorghum. He also operates a motorcycle transport business.

Jeremiah has requested a loan of 63,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He says the income will help to pay for the education of the children. He plans to buy more dairy cows in the future.

He says the lack of enough animal feed due to insufficient rains, remains a challenge though surmountable with proper planning.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Wilson Antonio

texts.es: Desde hace 6 años, Wilson de 35 años de edad,  inició su tarea emprendedora con una distribuidora de helados, aprovechando que un familiar suyo tenía ese   negocio y se imposibilitaba darle continuidad, pues debía viajar a otro país. Así fue como Wilson empezó y hoy distribuye su producto entre 12 vendedores que tienen sus carros de helados y venden en las calles de la ciudad; Los insumos y materias primas Wilson los compra de contado en una productora especializada de insumos de helados y su trabajo lo desarrolla en  un horario que inicia a las 9 de la mañana y termina a las 12 del medio día; y posteriormente desde las 2 hasta las 6 de la tarde cuando finaliza sus tareas, de lunes a domingo. Su meta es asumir la distribución directa para ofrecer su producto a más de 50 carros que repartan en toda la ciudad los deliciosos  helados y en el futuro tener su propia casa, con lo que produzca., pus desea genera cada día un mayor bienestar a su familia conformada por su cónyuge y sus 2 hijas en las edades de 4 y 5 años. En la actualidad está aplicando  aun credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará  helados y carritos de helados, para iniciar el camino a la meta que se propone; su inversión supone éxito, pues conoce su mercado, pues en él se ha desempeñado durante 6 años y quiere continuar desempeñándose por mucho tiempo hasta convertirlo en una gran empresa.
texts.en: For the past six years, Wilson, 35 years old, has had an ice cream distribution business. One of his family members had this business but he couldn’t continue with it as he had to travel to another country. This is how Wilson began this business. Today he distributes his product to twelve salespeople who have ice cream carts in the city. The basic supplies and materials Wilson buys on credit from an ice cream producer. He works from 9am until noon and then from 2pm until 6pm or until he finishes his work. He works from Monday to Sunday. His goal is to increase the carts he supplies with delicious ice cream to more than fifty in the city.  In the future he would like his own home. Each day he would like to improve the welfare of his family, which includes his wife and two daughters, ages four and five. This is his first loan with KIVA, through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. With this loan he will buy ice cream and carts in order to begin to reach his goals. This investment will be successful, as he knows the market since he has been involved with it for six years. He would like to continue growing his business for a long time so that it will eventually become a great company.

loans.use: to buy ice cream and carts.

loans.name: Fagasau

texts.en:
Fagasau is 62 years old and married with eight children. She plans to start a business selling goods in her store like flour, sugar, salt, snacks, tins of herring, corned beef, chicken and mutton flaps. She has requested a loan to buy more flour, sugar, snacks, washing soap, laundry powder and soft drinks.

Fagasau will use her profits to fund her kids' education and buy more goods to improve her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2008.

loans.use: to buy sugar, tins of herring, washing soap and laundry powder, among other items, to stock her store.

loans.name: Gwen

texts.en:
Gwen is a 20-year-old married woman with no children. She would like to start growing a vegetable garden. To earn a living. Gwen has requested a loan to buy more vegetable seeds, fertilizer, a plant sprayer, etc. 

She has been a member of SPBD for two years. Gwen will spend her profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables seeds. fertilizer, and weed killer

loans.name: Clarisa

texts.es:
Clarisa tiene 21 años, su pareja es Omar, de 23 años. Viven en la casa que compraron juntos, con su pequeña hija Luana, a quien desean brindarle un mejor futuro.
Clarisa y su pareja son jóvenes de provecho, para obtener su propia parcela tuvieron que trabajar como jornaleros mucho tiempo. Hace 2 años tiene su propia hectárea de terreno con cultivos de cacao, pero esta actividad la realizan hace 7 años. Sus cosechas las llevan a las asociaciones recolectoras, quienes les pagan muy bien por sus granos de cacao. Sus planes a futuro son de tener un tienda en su casa para estar junto a su hija sin tener que hacer mucho esfuerzo en la chacra.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser puntual con sus pagos para que en otra oportunidad logre acceder a otro. En su banco comunal es parte de la junta directiva.
Con los 500 nuevos soles que solicita comprará un saco de abono natural para fertilizar sus plantas.
texts.en:
Clarisa is 21 years old; her partner is Omar who is 23 years old. They live in the house that they bought together and live with their young daughter, Luana to whom they wish to give a better future.

Clarisa and her partner are good young people. To have their own parcel of land they had to work as day laborers for a long time and about 2 years ago they have owned their own hectare of land that is filled with cocoa crops; they have farmed for over 7 years. Their crops are taken to collecting associations who pay them very well for their cocoa beans. Their future plans are to have a small grocery store in their home to be close to their daughter without having to work too hard on the farmland.

This is Clarisa’s first loan through MFP and is committed to being punctual with her payments so that she can have access to another in the future. In her communal bank she is part of the managing board.

With the 500 nuevos soles, Clarisa will buy a sack of natural manure to fertilize her plants.

loans.use: buy a sack of natural manure to fertilize her plants.

loans.name: Rosa Estela

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal PROSPERIDAD;la socia continua con su negocio de compra y venta de electrodomesticos y ropa ,la socia trabaja de forma independiente,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su negocio cada dia,la socia reparte su mercaderia a sus clientes que mas le solicitan como amistades y familiares,ella viaja cada cierto tiempo a Tacna y Chile para comprar su mercaderia,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia,la socia a la vez continua con su negocio de restaurante el cual le va bien.

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de insumos como arroz y aceite para su restaurante.

La socia se siente feliz por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Communal Bank, Prosperity. The member continues her business of buying and selling household electronics and clothing. The member works independently and has been in the business for a long time and has done well thanks to the effort that she puts into her business everyday. The member sells her merchandize to the customers who most need it like friends and family, she travels at a certain time to Tacna and Chile to buy her merchandize. The member is a very responsible and diligent person since this is the way that she gets her family ahead.At the same time, she still continues with her restaurant business which is also doing well.

The member needs the loan to buy materials like rice and oil for her restaurant.

The member is happy for the loan given and is committed to making all of her payment quotas.

loans.use: buy materials like rice and oil for her restaurant.

loans.name: Gaulua

texts.en:
Gaulua  is 46 years old and married, with five children. 

She runs a small business selling snacks, donuts, soft drinks, pork cakes, and bbq in her community.  She has been doing this for two years. 

Gaulua has requested a loan to buy more soft drinks, snacks, donuts, chicken, and bags of rice. 

She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Gaulua will use her profits to improve her business and help her kids' education.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, snacks, and donuts to sell.

loans.name: Aiga

texts.en:
Aiga is a 27-year-old woman who is married with three children. She runs a sewing business in her community. She has four years of experience with this business. 

Aiga has requested a loan to buy a new sewing machine, dozens of threads, packet of needles and sewing materials. She plans to use her profits to help her kids' educations. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, threads and needles.

loans.name: Juana Bautista

texts.es: Juana de 29 años de edad  en condición de mujer separada y madre de 2 hijos en las edades de 6 y 5 años, trabaja con mucho esmero para lograr sacar a sus pequeños adelante. Ella  aprendió el oficio de peluquería hace 5 años y lo ejerció en su pueblo natal Chivolo, en el departamento del Magdalena; fecha en la cual se radicó en el municipio de Puerto Colombia, lugar ubicado a orillas del mar caribe y donde ejerce su actividad como estilista. Su meta mas adelante es organizar su propio salón de bellezas y una miscelánea en el mismo local, pues en la actualidad  atiende   a domicilio a una clientela fija, que ha ganado poco a poco y a quienes les ofrece mercancías variadas, como otro de las actividades a las que se dedica, para generar ingresos que beneficien el bienestar de sus hijos. Ella vende a crédito perfumes, ropa y calzado, entre otros artículos que le encargan sus clientes y estos le pagan en 3 o 4 partidas quincenales. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer crédito que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará una silla de peluquería, un lavacabezas y mercancia variada solicitada en su preventa, por los clientes, a los cuales aspiraq con su credikiva dar una respuesta oportuna y ganarse aun mas su fidelidad. .
texts.en: Juana is 29 years old, separated and the mother of two children, ages 6 and 5. She works hard to help her children succeed. Five years ago she learned the hairdressing business. She does this work in her native village called Chivolo, which is located in the department of Magdalena, in the municipality of Puerto Colombia. This place is located on the shores of the Caribbean. This is where she is a hair stylist. Her future goal is to have her own beauty salon, where she also sells miscellaneous items, in this same town. She has a stable clientele, who she has acquired slowly. She sells them miscellaneous items in addition to cutting their hair. This gives her additional income that she can use to support her children. She sells, on credit, perfume, clothes and shoes among other items that her customers need. They pay her three or four payments, one payment every fifteen days. This is her first loan with KIVA and her first loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. With this loan she will buy a beautician chair, a hair washing station and various merchandise that her customers have requested. With this loan she will have further opportunities to have a gain customer loyalty.

loans.use: to buy a beautician chair, a hair washing station and various merchandise.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
On the table seen above, Theresa sells doughnuts and oranges displayed on it. She sells different kinds of fruits at Enyinase near Elmina. 

Theresa has received a junior high education. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a farmer. She assists her husband in the general upkeep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy a variety of fruits to sell and also to buy flour, sugar and cooking oil to fry her doughnuts for sale. She hopes to use the new profits to acquire plots of land.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fruits to sell and also to buy flour, sugar and cooking oil to fry her doughnuts for sale.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua smokes fish for sale at Enyinase. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a farmer. Efua has been preparing smoked fish for ten years now. She supports her partner to educate feed and clothe her children. Her loan will be used to buy extra cartons of fish to smoke for resale. She hopes to use the new profits to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy extra cartons of fish to smoke for resale.

loans.name: Fapito

texts.en:
Fapito  is a 22-year-old single woman, with no children. 

She has a small plantation and grows taro, yam, and taamu to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. 

Fapito has requested a loan to buy weed spray, weed killer, fertilizers, spades, baby taro, and a new crowbar.

She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. With her profits, Fapito hopes to use her profits to help her family matters and to improve her business,

loans.use: to buy weed spray, weed killer, fertilizer, spades, and a new crowbar.

loans.name: Tepora

texts.en:
Tepora  is a 28-year-old married woman, with three children. 

She has a small plantation where she grows taamu, yams, bananas,  taro, tomatoes, green beans, and pumpkins to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. 

Tepora has requested a loan to buy fertilizers, weed spray, weed killers, bush knives, a new crow bar, and a rake.

She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. With her profits, Tepora hopes to help her kids' educations and her family matters.

loans.use: to buy weed spray, fertilizer, weed killer, bush knives, and a rake.

loans.name: Uilou

texts.en:
Uilou is a 28-year-old married woman, with three children. 

She has a small plantation where she grows cabbages, green beans, tomatoes, carrots, and cucumbers to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. 

Uilou has requested a loan to buy chemicals, weed spray, fertilizers, shovels, a pair of hoses, and a wheelbarrow.  She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. 

With her profits, Uilou hopes to help her kids' educations and family matters.

loans.use: to buy weed spray, fertilizer, shovels, and a wheelbarrow.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena is married and has three children. Abena makes and sells soap at Mbeam near Abura, which she has done for three years. Her husband is a farmer. Abena uses her income to care for her children and pay other household expenses. Abena will use the loan to purchase soap in bulk. With the new profits from her expanded business, Abena plans to continue to expand her business and care for her family.

loans.use: to purchase soap in bulk.

loans.name: Masina

texts.en:
Masina is 43 years old and married, with four children. 

She runs a small business selling snacks, soft drinks, donuts, long buns, pork cakes, and bbq in her community.  She has been doing this for two years.

Masina has requested a loan to buy more snacks, drinks, new frying pans, flour, sugar, chicken, and soya. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. 

With her earnings, Masina will use her profits to help her family matters.

loans.use: snacks, flour, sugar, soft drinks, and a new frying pan.

loans.name: Sueifo

texts.en:
Sueifo  is a 27-year-old married woman with three children. 

She has a small plantation where she grows taro, taamu, yams, and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. 

Sueifo has requested a loan to buy weed spray, weed killer, spades, a crowbar, a mist blower, and fertilizers.   She is a new member of SPBD. 

With her profits, Sueifo hopes to improve her business and help her kids' education.

loans.use: to buy weed killer, weed spray, a crowbar, and a mist blower.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en: Juanita is a 43-year-old woman who is married with 4 children. She runs an elei (traditional, painted clothing) business in her community. She has many years of experience with this business. Juanita has requested a loan to buy fabric materials, paints, brushes, designs, etc. She plans to use her profits to support her family and to maintain her business. She joined SPBD in July 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: To buy fabric materials, paints, brushes, designs, etc.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 38 years old and married with six children. She runs a small business that sells BBQ in her community, and she has been doing this for three years. Esther has requested a loan to buy one case of lamb chops, one case of chicken legs, one case of sausages, etc. She joined SPBD recently to gain access to financial services. With her earnings, Esther will support her family and maintain her business.

loans.use: To buy lamb chops, chicken legs, sausages, onions, soy sauce, etc.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama sells kenkey (a popular Ghanaian food) and farmed products at Mbeam near Abura. Ama has received education through middle form 4.  She is divorced. Ama has been selling kenkey and farmed products for 20 years. She is responsible for caring for her children and paying other household expenses. Her loan will be used to purchase ingredients in bulk for her kenkey. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to continue to expand her business and care for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients in bulk for her kenkey (a popular Ghanaian food).

loans.name: Vaituutuu

texts.en: Vaituutuu is 47 years old and married with six children. She would like to start a small business, making elei (handmade printed fabrics). In order to do this, Vaituutuu needs a loan to buy more materials: paints, brushes, etc. She hopes to use her profits to expand the business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: purchase paints, brushes, and roll materials for making Elei.

loans.name: Talosaga

texts.en: Talosaga is 59 years old and married with four children. She plans to start a business selling items such as sugar, flour, soap, snacks, and so forth. She has requested a loan to buy more daily-use products for sale. Talosaga will use her profits to expand the business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to purchase items such as sugar, coffee, salts, snacks, and soft drinks for sale.

loans.name: Sulieti

texts.en:
Sulieti is a 56-year-old married woman, with six children. 

She has a small plantation and grows cocoa and coconuts to earn a living. She has been doing this for four years.

Sulieti has requested a loan to buy more cocoa plantlings, a mist blower, palm spray, and fertilizers. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. 

With her profits, Sulieti hopes to improve her business for her better future .

loans.use: to buy a mist blower, palm spray, fertilizer, and cocoa plantlings.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort sells secondhand clothes at Mbeam near Abura. Comfort has received education through middle school.  She is divorced and has two children. She has been selling secondhand clothes for five years. She is responsible for caring for her children and paying other household expenses. 

Comfort's loan will be used to buy more clothes to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to continue to expand her business and care for her family.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Aakanisi

texts.en: Aakanisi is a 45-year-old married woman with four children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, yams, ta'amu, and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. Aakanisi has requested a loan to buy weed killer, fertilizer, seeds, etc. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. With her profits, Aakanisi hopes to expand her business and pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy weed killer, bush knives, fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Poto

texts.en:
Poto is a 40-year-old woman who is married with one child. 

She runs an elei fabric printing business in her community. She has many years of experience with this business. Poto has requested a loan to buy fabrics, paints, brushes, and designs. 

She plans to use her profits to support her family and to maintain her business. She joined SPBD in July 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy paintbrushes, paints, and fabrics.

loans.name: Miriama

texts.en:
Miriama is 53 years old and married, with three children. 

She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as sugar, flour, onion, rice, snacks, and other consumer needs. She has been doing this for four years. 

Miriama needs a loan to purchase a new refrigerator, sugar, flour, and rice. 

She hopes to use her profits to save for her family's needs and wants. She became a member of SPBD in 2008 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a new refrigerator, sugar, salt, rice, and snacks.

loans.name: Lotovale

texts.en:
Lotovale  is a 55-year-old married woman, with five children. 

She has a small plantation where she grows banana and taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for four years. 

Lotovale has requested a loan to buy a new wheelbarrow, fertilizer, chemicals, and a shovel for the plantation. She has been a member of SPBD since 2008. 

With her profits, Lotovale hopes to extend her plantation and start another business for the next two years.

loans.use: to buy a new wheelbarrow, fertilizer, chemicals, and a shovel.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is 32 years old and married with two children. She plans to start a business, a shop which sells daily-use goods. She has requested a loan to buy more goods such as flour, sugar, salt, meat, snacks, etc. Maria will use her profits to expand the business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: purchase flour, sugar, salt, meat, and snacks for sale.

loans.name: Niuia

texts.en: Niuia is a 56-year-old married woman with seven children. She makes and sells ice cakes in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. Niuia needs a loan to buy sacks of sugar, flavors, plastic cups, etc. She plans to use her profits to expand the business. Niuia has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: purchase sugar, flavors, plastic cups, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Mesepi

texts.en: Mesepi is a 51-year-old married woman with six children. She has a small plantation and grows green beans, cabbage, green peppers, and green onions to earn a living. She has been doing this for one year. Mesepi has requested a loan to buy fertilizers, a hose set, seeds, and spades. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. With her profits, Mesepi hopes to pay for her kids' educations and other family expenses.

loans.use: purchase fertilizer, seeds, spades, etc. for her farming business.

loans.name: Tuamaalo

texts.en: Tuamaalo is 48 years old and married with six children. She owns and operates a small store that sells items such as sugar, salt, onions, flour, snacks, and other things. She has been doing this for two years. Tuamaalo needs a loan to purchase sugar, flour, onions, and noodles. She hopes to use her profits to expand her store. She became a member of SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: To buy sugar, salt, flour, onions, snacks, etc.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
CARMEN ES UNA MUJER DE 29 AÑOS DE EDAD, ESTA CASADA Y TIENE 3 HIJOS. ELLA SIEMPRE A BUSCADO LA MANERA DE AYUDAR A SU ESPOSO CON LOS GASTOS Y LAS NECESIDADES QUE SE PRESENTAN EN SU FAMILIA. POR ESO A REALIZADO DIFERENTES ACTIVIDADES QUE LE PERMITAN OBTENER UN POCO MAS DE INGRESOS. 
ACTUALMENTE REALIZA UNA VENTA DE PLATILLOS DE COMIDA DIARIA PARA UNOS TRABAJADORES DE UNA MAQUILADORA. ELLA SE ORGANIZO CON UNA AMIGA PARA LLEVAR A CABO ESTE PEQUEÑO NEGOCIO. LAS DOS REALIZAN APORTACIONES Y SE DIVIDEN LAS GANANCIAS. PERO CARMEN NOS COMENTA QUE EL NEGOCIO A IDO CRECIENDO Y NECESITA COMPRAR MAS EQUIPO DE COCINA ASI COMO INVERTIR UN POCO MAS EN LA COMPRA DE INGREDIENTES Y  REFRESCOS PARA EL NEGOCIO A FIN DE PODER SATISFACER A SUS CLIENTES Y OBTENER MAS INGRESOS.
texts.en:
Carmen is a 29 year old woman, is married and has 3 children. She has always sought ways to help her husband with the expenses and necessities that her family faces. For that she has done different jobs that allow her to obtain a little more income.
Today she sells platillos (entrees served with rice and beans) of daily food for some workers of the factory. She organized this small business with a friend. Both make contributions and divide the profits. But Carmen tell us that the business has been growing and she needs to buy more cooking equipment as well as investing a little more into the purchase of ingredients and drinks for the business in order to be able to satisfy her customers and obtain more income.

loans.use: to buy materials and products for the creation of platillos, or an entree served with rice and beans.

loans.name: Chrispine

texts.en:
Chrispine lives in Malindi area of Coast Province, Kenya. She has three children, two of whom attend school. She is a fish monger, a business that she has been operating for three years and from which she earns a salary.

She learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are high transport costs and fuel costs, seasonal markets and high taxes.

Chrispine is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings to buy a sack of fish. Her extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to help in buying basic needs and improve on the living standard of her family. Her dream is to open a cafe.

loans.use: to buy a sack of fish.

loans.name: Sala

texts.en: Sala is a 49-year-old woman who is married with five children. She has a small business running bingo games. To earn extra income, she is also looking forward to repairing the house. Sala needs a loan to buy a metal roof, a bingo machine, timber, ceiling boards, etc. She will use her profits to expand her business. Sala joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: purchase a metal roof, a bingo machine, timber, and ceiling boards.

loans.name: Kerta Jaya Amerta Group

texts.en:
Kerta Jaya Amerta group gets the fifth loan from MUK. With nine members, the group's loans total 13,5M IDR. Two of the previous members resigned because they have enough savings to run their businesses on their own, but the group also has one new member. One member was ill and could attend the meeting, and is therefore not pictured. 

The loan will be used to buy piglets and repair cages. Ni Nengah, the head of the group, will be using her portion of the loan to buy three superior piglets. The price for a superior pig is currently very expensive, ranging from 400,000 - 500,000 IDR. These pigs will be maintained for five months for fattening. Ni Nengah expects that during the loan period, the pig will be able to develop properly, without being attacked by disease. With this effort, she will improve her savings in order to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy three superior piglets.

loans.name: Ratna Sari Group

texts.en: The Ratna Sari group has requested a new loan. There are 15 members, and the total loan amount is 20,000,000 IDR. Having been successful with raising piglets, Ni Putu will use this loan to purchase four pigs. The remainder of the loan will be used to make a special cage for the preparation of the birth of a new animal. The price of pig feed is currently very expensive, but she remains optimistic about her business going forward. With her profits, she plans to repair her home and save for her family's future.

loans.use: To purchase four pigs

loans.name: Delphine

texts.fr: Delphine est une femme agée de 49 ans divocée mère de 4 enfants dont l'age varie entre 15 et 23 ans , tous sont scolarisés. Elle a aussi 5 autres personnes à sa charge. Elle commerçante et exerce son activité dans  unn quartier de la capitale  depuis 6 mois. elle vend le bois de chauffage, et des produits alimentaire (riz, arachide et poisson) en fonction des saisons. la bonne qualité de sa marchandise et sa sociabilité lui permis en peu de temps de conquérir et fideliser la clientèle. la croissance de sa clietèle rend l'offre inférieure à la demande d'où la necessité de crédit pour son activté. il lui permettra d'augmenter les stoks (un sac de riz, d'arachide, un carton de poisson et le bois de chauffage en gros). ceci afin d'éviter les rupture de stocks, de satisfaire sa clientèle et d'augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire. Les bénéfices générés par ce crédit seront réinvestis en partie dans son activté pour l'aggrandir et le reste l'aidra à resoudre certains problemes quotidiens
texts.en:
Delphine is a 49-year-old divorced mother of 4 children between the ages of 15 and 23 years old, all of whom attend school. She also has 5 other dependents under her care. She has been a shopkeeper in a neighborhood of the capital for 6 months. Delphine sells firewood and food products (rice, groundnuts, and fish) depending on the season. 

The high quality of her merchandise and her outgoing personality allow Delphine to attract and retain customers in a short amount of time. The growth of her customer base has meant supply has fallen short of demand, which is what prompts her need for a loan for her business. This loan will allow Delphine to increase her inventory (roughly one bag of rice, groundnuts, a package of fish, and firewood). This will enable her to avoid depleting her inventory, to satisfy her customers and to increase her profit margin. 

The profits generated by this loan will be partially reinvested into Delphine's business in order to grow it, and the remainder will help her address various everyday issues.

loans.use: to purchase food products (bags of rice, groundnuts, and a package of fish) and firewood

loans.name: Tegal Badeng Indah Group

texts.en:
To improve her bussines, Ni Ketut continues her loans with MUK. Supported by her husband, Ni Ketut feels happy to run this business. With 1,5M IDR in loans, Ni Ketut will purchase four pigs for fattening. The pigs will be kept for five months and then sold. She hopes the pigs can grow healthy and fat.

One member, Ngaben, could not attend the meeting because she has a religious ceremony.  She is not pictured here.

loans.use: to purchase four pigs for fattening

loans.name: Rukhsana's Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana is 37 years old.  She is a hard-working housewife who lives in Punjab, Pakistan, with her husband, son, and daughter. 

For 15 years her husband has run a car care and services shop to meet the needs of his family with his meager savings. He is highly specialized in fixing dents and painting cars, and his clients always appreciate his services.

As a member of a two-person lending group, Rukhsana has requested a loan from KIVA partner BRAC Pakistan to by tools and help her husband in the growth of his shop.  The loan will help the family to increase their monthly savings as well as to meet their household needs.

loans.use: To buy tools for her husband's car repair and services shop.

loans.name: Vecinas Unidas Group

texts.en:
Regina is the coordinator of her group, Vecinas Unidas (United Neighbors). Her group is located in Samana peninsula, an area of the Dominican Republic with a nascent tourism industry, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple, rented structure with her long-term partner and two children.

Regina is excited to be taking her seventh loan with Kiva partner Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her jewelry business by purchasing earrings, necklaces, and bracelets for her store. She will use the profits to purchase school supplies for her children, and she will save towards her dream of building her own home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy silver jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Cheikh

texts.fr:
Cheikh est un novice à l’IMCEC, il vient pour la 1ère fois solliciter un crédit de 50000F CFA. Il fait de l’élevage depuis 7 ans maintenant, et démarre sa journée à 7 h du matin pour la terminer à 19 h du soir. Il est marié et père de famille.
L e crédit qu’il sollicite lui permettra de compléter l’argent qu’il dispose afin de pouvoir acheter un cheval destiné au transport de ciment, sable, récoltes agricoles. Cela lui permettra de diversifier ses activités pour mieux appuyer à la dépense quotidienne du foyer. Lui permettra aussi de mettre un peu d’argent de coté.
 Dans l’avenir, il désirerait faire de l’embouche bovine.
texts.en:
Cheikh is a newcomer to IMCEC who is requesting 50000 francs CFA as his first loan. He has been breeding animals for 7 years, beginning each day at 7am and finishing it at 7pm. He is married and the father of a family. The loan Cheikh is requesting will be added to his own savings to allow him to purchase a horse, which will be used to transport cement, sand, and harvested crops.

This will allow Cheikh to diversify his business in order to better be able to address his daily household expenses. It will also allow him to put some money aside. In the future, Cheikh hopes to get into the business of fattening cows.

loans.use: to purchase a horse in order to transport cement, sand, and harvested crops

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es:
Manuel, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, porque está cultivando nuevamente granos básicos, para esto necesita comprarse insumos como el abono del cual comprará ocho sacos, pagará el alquiler de terreno, con esta ayuda  podrá tener lo necesario e iniciar el proceso de siembra.

Con el préstamo anterior logró tener una mejor producción y la cual pudo generar ingresos para su familia, gracias al préstamo con kiva su condición ahora es más solvente y sus cultivos han aumentado su capacidad de producción.
texts.en:
