Manuel has decided to go for a new loan, because he is again growing basic grains. To do this, he need to buy supplies such as the compost, of which he will buy eight sacks. He will pay to rent the land. With this help he will be able to have what he needs to begin the process of planting.

With the last loan he succeeded in having a better production, which was able to generate income for his family. Thanks to the loan with Kiva his condition now is more solvent and his fields have increased their production capacity.

loans.use: to buy compost and rent land

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds, and pesticides for her husband's business.

loans.name: Sam Art

texts.en:
Sam Art, 43, lives in a rural village of Kandal province’s Kandal Stoeng district, Cambodia. She is married and has four children, only one of whom is still attending school while the others work as garment workers to make their living and support the family. For the last seven years, Sam Art has been working as a garment worker while her husband is a paid construction worker. 

Sam Art has been a member of Kiva’s partner VisionFund for two cycles already and has completely repaid her loans. She has used the previous loan wisely and successfully to improve her family’s livelihood. After the two cycles with VisionFund, she now can earn about USD $14.80 per day to respond to her family’s needs and also manages to save about USD $9 each day for their future needs. Sam Art is now requesting another loan with VisionFund of USD $1,000, which she will use to buy a motorbike for her children to commute to work. This loan will enable Sam Art’s children to reduce travelling time and go to work in a timely and regular manner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her children to commute to work.

loans.name: Sreymom

texts.en:
Sreymom, 27, is married and lives with her family in a rural area in the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province. She is the mother of one son, who is her dependent. She earns a living through farming rice, a business she has been in for five years, while her husband is a paid construction worker to help support the family. Together, she and her husband can earn about $7 per day from the current business and are able to save about $4 each day for the future. 

This is the second loan for Sreymom with VisionFund. She has used the first loan wisely and successfully to improve her family’s livelihood. Now she is requesting another loan of $300 with VisionFund and she is going to use this loan, in addition to her savings, to buy a plot of farmland. This loan will enable her to extend her farmland so as to increase her rice farming production to better her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy milk and oil in bulk to sell as a wholesaler.

loans.name: Cleber Eduardo

texts.es:
Cleber Eduardo tiene 30 años, es casado vive con la esposa y con los  hijos. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama VRC SAN FRANCISCO DE SIBIMBE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Sibimbe, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta  ventanilla tiene 20socio los cuales se dedican a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembran maíz y arroz..

Cleber se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de urea, insecticidas, urea, insumos para la produccion.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como plagas que atacan a los cultivos. El sueño es seguir adelante con la esposa y con los hijos.. 

En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar con los hijos.
texts.en:
Cleber Eduardo is 30 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and children. He lives in the Ventanas canton in the province of Los Rios.

His communal bank is called VRC San Francisco de Sibimbe. It is located in the Sibimbe district in the Ventanas canton. This communal bank has 20 members who work in short-cycle agriculture. They plant corn and rice.

Cleber works in agriculture, planting corn and rice. He makes his purchases in Ventanas every month and sells his products at the fair in the same place.

He is applying for the loan to buy urea, insecticides, and supplies for production. The loan will help him economically to supply his necessities. He faces challenges such as the pests that attack his crops. His dream is to continue advancing with his wife and children.

In his free time he likes to play with his children.

loans.use: to buy urea, insecticides, and supplies for production

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is 44 years old from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She is married with four children. Her eldest is 18 and her youngest is 12. Linda is dependent in her hog raising business for an income. To augment her income, she is also into rice farming business. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for her farm and another piglet to raise if possible. Linda will spend her profit for her family's healthy diet and school fees of her children. 

In the future, she would like to have bigger  farm and a larger number of hogs that she can raise for a better profit.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm and another piglet to raise

loans.name: Batmunkh

texts.en:
Mr. Batmunkh, 51, is one of the skillful drivers in Mongolia. He has been running a taxi business since 2010. His wife sells clothes in the outdoor market all year round. Currently, he lives with his wife and daughter in a house in the ger district, a district of Mongolian traditional yurts and houses in the boundary of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

Last spring, he moved in his house where he is currently living. His house was built many years ago and lately the house has been in bad condition and is old. First, he wants to repair the walls inside and outside, because there is heat loss through the walls in winter. He must use coal in a large amount to heat his home. Using coal is harmful and emits too much toxic smoke into the air and air pollution has been seen as one of the critical issues in Mongolia for years. Batmunkh will use his loan to buy wall insulation materials to repair his house.

loans.use: to buy the wall insulation materials to repair his house.

loans.name: Sari Indah Group

texts.en: This is the Sari Indah group. They still need loans and training from MUK to be better pig breeders. Ni Ayu's loan of 1.5M IDR will be used to purchase five piglets. She will maintain the piglets for five months for fattening. She hopes the business will run well and she can get enough profit. She plans to renovation her kitchen from the profits.

loans.use: to purchase five piglets.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 25 years old and single.

Jenelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell.

Jenelyn has been in this business for seven years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Jenelyn aspires to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Gansukh

texts.en:
Mr. Gansukh, 51, is a taxi driver who services the districts of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He started his business in 1997, and since then, he has been operating his business nonstop. And he has had a lot of permanent customers in the past years. He lives with his family in a house in ger district, a slum district in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

In winter, he uses a coal fired furnace to heat his home and it emits too much smoke and harmful toxic substances into the air. Therefore, he decided to replace it with a smokeless stove, which is made with modern technology. Although Mongolia has the lowest population density in the world, it is one of the most polluted countries in the world. This is due to the long and cold winters, where temperatures frequently go below -40C (-40F) even in the cities. Also, in winter, many parts of the country are extremely cold and are known to have snow storms. Both homes and nomadic tents burn a lot of fuel and emit huge amounts of pollution every night from families just trying to stay warm. In addition, the extremely toxic smoke from cars is one of main causes of Mongolian air pollution. In response to this, Credit Mongol offers Green Loans to their clients to make home improvements that reduce heat loss, improve heating systems and buy cars on the natural gas.  

The loan Mr. Gansukh is taking will be used to cover the cost of the new smokeless stove in his house for reducing the pollution in the air.

loans.use: to cover the cost of the new smokeless stove in his house for reducing pollution in the air.

loans.name: Robina's Group

texts.en:
Robina is 37 years old and a housewife. She is living in Punjab, Pakistan with her four sons and a daughter . Her husband has owned a hotel for 30 years, which is the only source of income for their family. 

Robina, as a member of a two-person lending group, has requested a loan from KIVA partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase materials like flour, rice, pulses, vegetables etc.

She is very hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for them and will bring a positive change to their monthly income.

loans.use: To purchase material for her husband hotel business.

loans.name: Chinbat

texts.en:
Mr. Chinbat, 26 years old, is an army man, a first-sergeant.  For seven years he has been a military man; he joined the army just after he graduated from his high school. Currently he lives with his wife and their two sons in an apartment rented from his work. 

Recently he acquired a small land plot in the ger district, an area of Mongolian traditional yurts and houses in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. 

He said it is very important to start his own holdings. Now he is requesting a loan to build a brick fence on his land plot.

loans.use: To build brick fence on his land plot.

loans.name: Nen

texts.en:
Originally from a village of Kandal province’s Kandal Stoeng district, Nen is 43 years old and married with six children, four of whom are dependents and help support the family’s business. The other children have their own employment. For more than ten years, Nen and her husband have been farming rice as the primary source of the family’s income to make a living and they can earn about $6 per day, managing to save about $3 each day for their future needs. 

Nen has been a member of VisionFund for one cycle already and she wisely and successfully used the first loan to make her living conditions better. Now, she is applying for another loan of 1,000 to buy a plot of farmland. This loan will enable her to extend her farmland to increase her rice farming production to make more rice, in order  to improve her family’s life.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland.

loans.name: Lkhagva-Erdene

texts.en: Mr. Lkhagva-Erdene, 31, is a railway man and he has been doing this job for 5 years nonstop. He lives with his wife and their child in Ulaanbaatar, which is the capital city of Mongolia, in a small family house in the ger district, an area of the city with no running water, minimal roads, and spotty electricity. His wife works as a cook for the same company. In the winter, the family's house loses much heat though its door. So with this loan, he wants to cut the heat loss by building a small entrance room. The loan will be used to buy the building materials to build the entrance room.

loans.use: to build an entrance room to his house.

loans.name: Khurelbaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Khurelbaatar, 47, is a taxi driver and has been operating a taxi around Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He lives with his wife and his three children in his house, which is in the ger district, a community of Mongolian nomadic tents in the boundary area of the city. All of his three children are college students.

Khurelbaatar used to work as a driver in the state organization for many years; he suddenly left his job due to an occupational accident. 

His family furniture hasn't been updated since he married his wife many years ago; he wants to update most of these items. "It will be a big contribution to improve the living condition of my family,” Mr. Khurelbaatar said. He is taking a loan to cover the cost of the new furniture for his home.

loans.use: to cover the cost of new furniture for his home.

loans.name: Narantsetseg

texts.en: Mrs. Narantsetseg, 49, works as a machinist in one of the biggest copper concentrating factories in Mongolia. For 12 years, she has been doing her work nonstop and is one of the skillful masters in the factory. She lives with her husband and her son, 21, in her house in Erdenet, the third largest city in Mongolia. Recently, she built her house with her husband and son. She is very happy to be finished with building her house. Now she needs to make wall insulation for the roof hollow floor, because there is a heat loss through the ceiling and roof in wintertime. She is planning to completely insulate the roof hollow floor. She is taking a loan to buy the building materials needed to insulate her newly built house.

loans.use: to buy the building materials needed to insulate her newly built house.

loans.name: Pheap's Group

texts.en:
Pheap lives in a rural village in the Krokor district of Pursat Province, Cambodia. She is 30 years old and married with six children, five of whom are still in school in the local area. To support her big family, she has been working as a rice farmer on three-hectare farmland for more than ten years, while her husband is a doctor. The current business earns her about 25,000KHR per day to make a living and she can afford to save 15,000KHR each day after expenses. Low crop yield has been a challenge for her business. 

This is Pheap’s group loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She and another member is just a member of VisionFund while the other is the second cycled client. Now she is leading her group of three female members to apply for a loan. Pheap will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend for land plowing. With this loan, she hopes to make more healthy rice to increase her family’s income to make a better living and be able to afford to buy some household necessities for the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Sokha is a 51-year-old mother of two children and earns a living through farming rice on a one-hectare area of farmland, while her husband catches fish to earn extra income to support the family. Sokha has been in the farming business for 19 years and the current business earns her about 28,000KHR per day to feed the family. Lack of working capital is the main challenge for her to better support the family’s business. 

Sokha is a second cycled client with VisionFund. She wisely and successfully used her first loan from VisionFund to better support her family’s living and the business. Now applying for another loan of 601,000KHR with VisionFund, she wants to use this loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion to buy fishing nets for her husband’s business. She hopes to increase her family’s income from the current business to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Khusrav

texts.en:
Khusrav is 31 years old. He is married and has 2 daughters. His wife is a housewife, so Khusrav is the family's sole bread-winner. With the aim to provide his family with modern conveniences, he began own business three years ago. He sells a variety of home products, such as pans, teapots, plates, lamps, etc. He stores his merchandise in a shop. He wants to develop his business, but he does not have enough money for it. He is asking for a loan of 5000 Somoni to buy goods as teapots, plates, and lamps to sell.

This is his first loan with Imon International organization, and he promises to make his payments on time. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy goods such as teapots, plates, and lamps to sell.

loans.name: Jean Roland

texts.fr: roland est une homme de 33 ans, fiancé et père de 2 enfants dont l'age varie entre 4 et 7 ans , tous sont scolarisés. il est commerçant et vend les produit de première necessité dans un marché de la place depuis 6 ans. sa saciabilité et son expérience dans ce domaine lui ont permis d'accroitre sa clientèle au fil du temps. il sollicite un crédit pour augmenter son stoks de marchandises, éviter les ruptures de stoks et augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire. ses bénéfices l'aideront à étendr son activité et a subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Roland is a 33-year-old man, a fiancé and father of two children ages 4 and 7, both of whom attend school. He is a shopkeeper, and has been selling staple products in a market in a square for the last 6 years. His outgoing personality and his experience in his field of business allows Roland to acquire customers easily as time goes by. 

Roland is requesting a loan in order to increase his inventory of merchandise, to avoid a shortage of goods, and to increase his profit margin. His profits will help him to continue his business and to support the basic needs of his family.

loans.use: to purchase 5 drums of refined oil, 2 bags of rice, and groundnuts

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Parveen is 43 years old and married, living in Punjab, Pakistan, with two daughters and a son. For 20 years, her husband has been selling meat and is interested in buying more products for his shop so that he can increase his monthly income, as well as savings, by selling more meat.

Parveen, as a member of a four-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan in order to help her husband with buying large quantities of meat for his shop. 

With any profits, she will be able to save money for her future, pay school fees for her children, and reinvest in her husband business.

Note: In the picture Parveen carrying a passbook in her hand .

loans.use: to buy more meat  for her husband's butcher shop.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Fe & Amor 1 & 6 Group

texts.en:
Violeta is the coordinator of her group Fe y Amor (Faith and Love) 1 & 6. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their three children. She said her most difficult challenge is to work in a foreign country. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoy attending church and taking care of her family.

Violeta is excited to be taking her 11th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for around 5 years, starting it with her savings. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying meat to be sold in her butcher shop. She will put the profits in savings and reinvest in the business to buy more products.

This group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, an area where the economy is dominated by sugarcane and upscale tourism. Violeta thanks all of you for your support!!!

loans.use: to buy beef and pork meat for her butcher shop

loans.name: Ujamaa Group

texts.fr: La cliente Shamy est trésorière du groupe de crédit Ujamaa, Femme courageuse, entrepreneur, veuve de son état, âgée de 42 ans et mère de 10 enfants. Elle est Vendeuse d’arachides. Il commença ses affaires avec son fonds propre reçu de son mari après vente de leur voiture. La cliente bénéficie régulièrement des crédits de Hekima pour renforcer ses affaires. Les bénéfices de son activité servent d’épargne, d’alimentation et d’appui à la scolarité de ses enfants. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir son 19eme crédit. Au cours de la période, cette cliente a vu ses ventes augmentées et réaliser d'autres micro projets pour sa famille. Ainsi elle a décidé d’augmenter son montant de crédit pour ce nouveau cycle. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir d’acheter les 2 sacs d’arachides. Ses difficultés sont souvent la rupture de stock et la fluctuation de prix lors de semi. La cliente souhaite voir ses enfants grandir et construire une clôture dans le futur. La cliente remercie Hekima pour les actions d’autonomisation de pauvres femmes à faible revenu.Il sied de signaler que certaines clientes portent leurs bébés.
texts.en:
Shamy is the treasurer of the Ujamaa loan group. She is a courageous woman, an entrepreneur, a widow, 42 years old and mother of 10 children. She is a seller of groundnuts. Shamy began her business with her own funds, which she received from her husband after they sold their car. She regularly receives loans from Hekima to further her business.

The profits from Shamy's business go to savings, food, and schooling for her children. She has just obtained her 19th loan. During the time she has been borrowing, Shamy has seen her sales rise and has accomplished other small projects for her family. She has thus decided to increase her loan amount for this latest loan.

This new loan will allow Shamy to purchase two bags of groundnuts. Her main challenges are the depletion of her inventory and price fluctuations. Shamy hopes to see her children grow up and to build a fence in the future. She thanks Hekima for their support of poor women with meager incomes.

It should be noted that certain members of the group are shown holding their babies.

loans.use: to purchase two bags of groundnuts

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is 50 years old, and she is a hardworking woman with a great desire to progress in life. Her lifetime’s partner and her elder son help her with business. Ludmila’s smaller son doesn't help with the business. She is one of the successful businesswomen of her town. For more than 12 years, she has been busy with the selling of food items. She knows all aspects of her business very well. Her experiences and skills help her to develop business and in this way improve her living conditions. She wants to develop her business further and buy more food items to sell, but her income is small and she needs your help and mercy.

This is the fourth loan she is requesting from a microlending organization (MLO), and she feels deeply grateful for the economic support she has received to achieve her goals. She is also grateful for the support received by the members of IMON International as she trusts them and feels at ease with them.

loans.use: To buy food items to sell.

loans.name: Anipa

texts.ru: Анипе 40 лет, замужем, воспитала 4 детей.  Анипа с 1998 года занимается заготовкой и реализацией сушеных фруктов и ягод, таких как яблоки, груши, сливы, шиповник, начав этот бизнес с 3,000 сом (KGS). Также Анипа занимается и животноводством, имея на сегодняшний день 4 головы крупного рогатого скота. В общем, хозяйство Анипы приносит около 15,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. Доходы позволяют Анипе оплачивать учебу для дочери – студентки. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Анипа обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на закуп фруктов для обработки, сушки и последующей реализации. Доходы Анипа планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Anipa is 40 years old and married with four children. Anipa has been drying and selling fruits and berries, such as apples, pears, plums, and rose hips, since 1998, having started this business with 3,000 KGS. Anipa also raises livestock. She currently has 4 heads of cattle.
Anipa's average income from her farm is about 15,000 KGS a month. This income lets her pay for her daughter's college education.
To grow her business further, Anipa has applied to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 100,000 KGS, which she will use to process, dry, and sell fruit. Anipa plans to invest the income from this loan to expand her further.

loans.use: to purchase fruits for drying

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
Jesús, solicita un préstamo ya que considera que a través de ellos han logrado mejorar su trabajo en el taller, en esta ocasión invertirá en la compra de fajas, llantas, amortiguadores, bujías, y otros repuestos que son necesarios para atender a los clientes y las demandas que presenten con sus automóviles.

Con estos préstamo y la inversion que realiza, él puede ofrecer hoy en día un mejor servicio con repuestos de calidad, ha aumentado su clientela fortaleciendo el negocio, esto le ha originado mejores ingresos para solventar sus necesidades familiares.
texts.en: Jesús is requesting another loan, through which has has been able to improve his auto repair shop. At this time he plans to invest in the purchase of belts, tires, shocks, spark plugs and other necessary parts so he can tend to customers and meet the demands of their vehicles. With this loan and the investment, he can offer a better service with quality parts. He has increased his clientele, strengthening his business. This has led to more income to help solve his family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase belts, tires, shocks and spark plugs.

loans.name: Litia

texts.en: Litia is 25 years old and married with 2 children. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as packs of twisties, soup, washing powder, packs of sugar, etc. She has been doing this for 2 years. Litia needs a loan to buy more stock for her shop. She hopes to use her profits to expand. She became a member of SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy soap, washing powder, twisties, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Vineta

texts.en: Vineta is 23 years old and married with 2 children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for 2 years. Vineta has requested a loan to buy sacks of sugar, flour, baking powder, etc. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Vineta will expand the business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, baking soda, and oil

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy buffalo for her son's livestock business

loans.name: Tina

texts.en: Tina is a 32-year-old woman who is married with 2 children. She has a small business running a taxi. She has been in this business for 2 years. Tina needs a loan to buy spare tires and spare parts. She will save her profits, as she is looking forward to buying another taxi. Tina joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy tires, filter oil, fluid oil, etc.

loans.name: Muharram

texts.en: Muharram is one of the smartest members of her family. She is 49 years old. Her husband Alijon is a very kind man who always supports Muharram.  They are bringing up 3 children. Muharram and her husband try to provide them a high quality of living. With this aim, 15 years ago she began her own business selling children’s clothes. She sells her goods in a local market and has many customers. She wants a wide assortment for the new season, but her income is small and she can’t do it. She is asking for a loan of 9,000 somoni to buy a new variety of clothes to sell. Each month she will make her payment on time. She will be happy if you support her.

loans.use: to buy a new variety of clothes to sell

loans.name: Boyaly

texts.en:
Boyaly is from Tajikistan.  He loves his country very much. He is 31 years old. Boyaly is married to a lovely woman by name of Shahnoza and has 2 children. To make a living, he sells food items in a shop. He has been engaged in his business for 7 years and earns little money for these activities. He is requesting a loan of 4,000 somoni which will be used to buy more food items to sell.
He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: To buy food items to sell

loans.name: Dildora

texts.en: Dildora is 20 years old, and she is not married. She sells cloth and women’s clothes to earn a living. She has been in the business for 4 years. Also she has additional income from selling ice cream in a shop. Her parents help her with her business. She dreams of expending her business and becoming prosperous in the future. She needs a loan of 6,000 somoni to buy cloth to sell. She will look for your help.

loans.use: to buy cloth to sell

loans.name: Xiomara

texts.es: La señora Xiomara tiene dos hijos, es casada, es docente en una escuela en donde imparte clases de español 8 horas diarias en una escuela, empezó a trabajar a la edad de 17 años, estudia la cerrera de licenciatura en pedagogía ha logrado llegar a su ultimo año de la carrera  con la ayuda de su familia, está solicitando el crédito para el pago del seminario de grado en pedagogía realizado en una universidad. Si no hubiese tenido acceso a este crédito, le afectaría mucho ya que con su titulo en mano le espera un puesto de trabajo donde sus ingresos aumentaría y podría seguir adelante y tendría que esperar más tiempo para obtener su titulo. Le interesa mucho su profesión por que le serviría también para trabajar dentro de una fundación de un comedor infantil en una comunidad. El mensaje que comparte con personas en  otras partes del mundo es que las oportunidades están frente a nosotros solo basta tomar el reto y que la palabra “no” no sea una derrota si no un reto para seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Xiomara is married and has two children. She is a school teacher and gives Spanish classes 8 hours a day. She started working when she was 17 years old.

Xiomara is studying education at the undergraduate level and has reached her last year of the major with the help of her family. She is requesting this loan for her university education costs. She would be greatly affected without this loan because her diploma will position her for a higher-paying job. She will be able to move forward rather than waiting longer to receive her diploma. 

Teaching interests Xiomara because it will also allow her to work within a foundation for a soup kitchen in the community.  

The message that Xiomara shares with people in other parts of the world is that opportunities are right in front of us, we just need to take on the challenges. The word "no" is not a defeat, but rather a challenge to overcome.

loans.use: to pay for her university education.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité Nueva Esperanza tiene 10 integrantes, mujeres de escasos recursos pero sacrificadas y dispuestas a lograr todos los objetivos propuestos para poder mejorar cada día.
La sra. María, una de las integrantes del grupo, cuenta con una despensa, la que desea seguir agrandando tanto en tamaño como en variedades de productos que ofrecer para así satisfacer las necesidades de su clientela y sus necesidades personales y familiares.
Con el crédito desea comprar verduras, hortalizas, lácteos, legumbres, para poder tener mayor variedad de productos que ofrecer.
texts.en: The Nueva Esperanza (New Hope) group consists of 10 members, hardworking women of scarce resources who are dedicated and prepared to achieve all of their goals in order to improve every day. One of the members of the group, María, has a convenience store that she wants to keep growing, as much in size as in variety of products, in order to satisfy the demands of her customers and meets the needs of her families. With the loan, she plans to purchase vegetables, dairy products and legumes to have a wider variety of products to offer.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, dairy products, legumes, etc.

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
El Comité San Miguel tiene 10 integrantes,esta iniciando muy entusiasmadamente su primer ciclo, se las ve optimistas y con ganas de sacar provecho a esta oportunidad.
Clara, una de las integrantes del grupo, se dedica a su despensa, donde vende variedades de productos y con lo que aporta a su propia canasta familiar y a la de su clientela, con el fin de satisfacer a su clientela y satisfacer también a su familia con este negocio.
El crédito será utilizado para la compra de mercaderías con la que logrará surtir aún más su despensa, como ser: panificados, lácteos, legumbres, bebidas, etc.
texts.en: The San Miguel Committee has 10 members.  The group is enthusiastically beginning its first cycle, and they are optimistic and want to profit from this opportunity.  Clara, one of group members, works in a store that sells various products with which she contributes to her own family's basic needs for staple goods and also to that of her customers.  As a result, she satisfies her customers and her family with this business.  The loan will be used for the purchase of merchandise to better supply her store: baked goods, dairy products, vegetables, drinks, etc.

loans.use: to buy dairy products, vegetables, fruit and baked goods

loans.name: Faida

texts.en: 31-year-old Faida lives in the southwest area of the town with her husband and her two children aged 4 and 1.5. She started her business idea early this year, because she saw a business opportunity in the demand for poultry supply and also in transport services. Her sister helps her in managing the poultry business. She's currently applying for her first Kiva loan, which she'll use to top up and purchase a motorcycle. She says that there is an opportunity in transport services. The motorcycle will also help her in the transport of chicks and chicken feeds, which will help her reduce the transport costs. Faida aims at owning several businesses so as to become a well-known merchant in the area.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara is from Tajikistan.  It’s a country where one can disconnect from the noise and appreciate the beauty of nature since its scenery is very beautiful. She loves her country very much. She is 50 years old. She is a widow and has 3 children. To make a living, she sells food items at a stand. She has been engaged in her business for 10 years. She lives in the village and that’s why all of her neighbors are her customers. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 somoni which will be used to buy more food items to sell.
She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To buy food products to sell

loans.name: Luz Elizabeth

texts.es:
Luz, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, para la compra de ropa, ya que actualmente está vendiendo de forma ambulante, siempre realiza la venta de tamales y la venta de pupusas, pero esta inversión requiere realizar únicamente en prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños,  en ropa interior, blusas, camisas, y otro tipo de mercadería.

Manifiesta que el préstamo anterior y ayudó en la compra de materiales para la elaboración de los tamales y de las pupusas, permitiéndole crear una mejor venta y tener todos los materiales a la mano, su condición familiar ha mejorado debido a los  mejores ingresos, hoy dia ha iniciado un nuevo rubro del cual espera tambien recibir ganancias.
texts.en: Luz has to decided to request another loan to purchase clothes, since right now she is selling in a variety of places. She is still selling tortillas and pupusas (thick corn tortillas), but this investment is only for clothes for men, women and children, like undergarments, blouses, shirts and other items. She says that her previous loan helped her buy supplies to make the tortillas and the pupusas, allowing her to increase her margins and have all her materials at hand. Her family's living conditions have improved thanks to the increased income. Now she has started a new trade and hopes to also turn a profit.

loans.use: to purchase undergarments, blouses and shirts.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a 40-year-old who sells brooms made from palm fronds. In addition to this, she sells fish, especially during the afternoon hour up to the evening, after returning from selling her brooms, which she sells through door-to-door.  She is a married mother of eight. She has been in this business for the last one month. She is a visionary woman who is always optimistic to move forward.

This is her first loan with Yehu and Kiva to finance her business. Joyce wants to incorporate a coconut selling business into her already existing businesses. She plans to purchase a sack of coconut for sale.

She will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan and to expand her business further. She hopes to have a bigger, more profitable business.

loans.use: to purchase a sack of coconut for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more products.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin has been in mixed farming for 10 years in his rural home in Kitale, where he lives with his family of five children aged between 3 and 15 years. He has been producing maize, eggs, groundnuts and vegetables.

Benjamin is in need of a 30,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) loan to buy poultry birds. He has made this request through Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo and hopes to grow his business and pay for his children's education. He aspires to venture into dairy farming once he repays his poultry loan.

He is happy he joined Juhudi Kilimo for a farming loan.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma is 28 years old. She lives in Akhmeta District with her husband Soso and her 72-year-old father-in-law. Irma requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is the monthly pension of Irma’s father-in-law and the small income earned by Soso, working as an agricultural worker in the village. It totals 250 Laris per month. It is hardly enough for food for a three-member family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs in the subsistence poor category. 

Irma requested a loan from Credo to restart the family business, which was stopped recently because of financial problems. Her loan request was approved in the frame of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit Irma will purchase a horse. Soso and Irma will go to the local forest and bring wood from the forest on the horse. They will sell the wood in the village and earn an income. The wood is mainly used by the village population in ovens to heat the houses and cook. The new business initiative will increase the monthly income of the family by 150 laris, which will mean a 60% increase. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a horse for the transportation of wood

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel has been in farming for three years, doing dairy, maize and vegetable farming in his rural home area in Kitale, Western Kenya. He is married with one child who is 4 years old.

Emmanuel has made a loan request amounting to 30,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds. He says the new venture has great potential for growth due to a ready market. He notes, however, that poultry farming is not without challenges, with disease outbreak being a threat, and needs proper management.

Emmanuel says seasonal changes limit the gains from farming, but he is hopeful that poultry farming faces the least challenge from this.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema lives in the Msambweni area of Coast province, Kenya. She is married with five children. She earns a living selling foodstuff from her home. Rehema sells food like flat breads, dumplings, etc., a business she has been operating for one year. 

She learned about Yehu through staff who invited her to the group, and she joined with an aim of accessing credit to improve the business operations. The challenge she is facing is the high price for the goods.

Rehema is applying for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to purchase wheat flour and cooking oil. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to pay school fees for her children. Her plan for the future is to expand her business and open a cafe. This way, she will have an assured income to continue educating her children.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more goods for his grocery business.

loans.name: Tsengelbayar

texts.en:
Tsengelbayar is 25 years old and lives with his wife and his daughter in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. He married in 2010. His wife is unemployed because his daughter was born 1 year ago and his daughter stays at home. 

Tsengelbayar and his father started a building construction service in 2008. The business is a family business. He said "My building construction service business is seasonal, because we are busy in summer time. But we have free time in winter time. I have no income in winter time." Tsengelbayar's monthly income does not usually meet his family's necessities, so he would like to start his own new taxi business. He is requesting an 1,100,000 MNT loan to purchase a motorcycle to start his new business.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to start his new business

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel lives in Tiribe, Kenya. He is married to a businesswoman, and they have six children who attend school. 

He tells us that he has had a carpentry business for the past 30 years. It is well stocked. He is a very hardworking person, eager to succeed and help his family, as he knows that life is hard, and working is the only way to get ahead.

He is applying for the loan in order to buy timber, nails and other supplies that he wishes to supply his business with, and to continue providing good products to his customers.

loans.use: to buy timber, nails and other supplies.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is a resident of Kitale, Western Kenya and has been in active farming for five years, running his farm with two farmhands and producing milk, maize and vegetables which provide for his family upkeep. He is married with a firstborn child being only four months old. He deals in charcoal and runs a barber shop besides farming.

Isaac will use the loan he has requested amounting to 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry. He says the venture into poultry farming will improve his farming income. He is glad Juhudi Kilimo is enabling farmers to acquire assets which inspire them to do farming not only for subsistence means but on a commercial scale.

He notes that farming capital is one of the major challenges smallholder farmers contend with.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Cristhian Javier De Jesus

texts.es: Cristhian es soltero estudia la carrera de licenciatura en derecho, está solicitando el crédito para el pago del curso de titulación. En un futuro se ve trabajando en su propio bufete jurídico, el deseo de superase como persona y cumplir con el sueño de sus padres de obtener una carrera lo inspira a seguir adelante, el desafío que ha enfrentado durante sus estudios fue el costo del transporte diario de Masaya a Managua para poder asistir a sus clases el cual fue superado con mucho esfuerzo de sus padres. El mensaje que comparte con otras personas es que estudien y aprovechen todos los sacrificios que realizan los padres para con sus hijos, ya que el estudio y profesión es lo único que nos queda.
texts.en: Cristhian is an unmarried student studying a degree in law. He is requesting the loan to pay for his course of study. In the future, he plans to open his own legal practice. His desires to improve himself as a person and to fulfill the dreams of his parents by obtaining a profession have inspired him to work hard to get ahead. One challenge he faced during his studies was the cost of commuting daily from Masaya to Managua to be able to attend classes. He overcame the challenge with a lot of effort on the part of his parents. The message he wants to share with others is to study hard and take advantage of all the sacrifices that parents do for their children, since our education and profession is all that remain with us.

loans.use: pay for his course of study at law school

loans.name: Yesenia Idalia

texts.es: YESENIA ESTA CASADA CON LUIS, TIENE 30 AÑOS DE EDAD Y TIENE UN HIJO QUE ACTUALMETNE ESTUDIA LA PRIMARIA. DESDE HACE ALGUNOS AÑOS ELLA TIENE UN NEGOCIO DE VENTA DE CUADROS Y ARREGLOS PARA EL HOGAR, ASI COMO DE BOTAS NUEVAS PARA HOMBRES. ELLA COMPARTE QUE LE GUSTA SU NEGOCIO YA QUE CON EL AYUDA A SU ESPOSO, EL CUAL TAMBIEN TIENE UN NEGOCIO DE ENDEREZADO Y PINTURA DE COCHES. Y CUANDO A SU ESPOSO SE LE DIFICULTA EL TRABAJO ELLA PUEDE APOYARLO CON LOS INGRESOS DE SU NEGOCIO DE CUADROS. POR ESTE MOTIVO ELLA DESEA HACER CRECER SU NEGOCIO Y REALIZAR UNA COMPRA MAYOR DE LOS PRODUCTOS QUE ELLA MANEJA, YA QUE A CONSEGUIDO TENER BUENOS CLIENTES LOS CUALES LE SOLICITAN MAS VARIEDAD. ASI QUE ELLA COMPARTE LA NECESIDAD DE SOLICITAR UN PRESTAMO CON EL CUAL PUEDA VIAJAR A LA CIUDAD DE MONTERREY A COMPRAR MAS MERCANCIA PARA SU NEGOCIO Y ASI PODER SEGUIR MANTENIENDO SU NEGOCIO PRODUCTIVO.
texts.en:
Yesenia is 30 years old and is married. She and her husband Luis have one child who is currently in grade school. 

For the past few years, Yesenia has had a business selling paintings and home decorations as well as men's boots. She likes her business because it allows her to help her husband, who also has a business of vehicle repair and painting. When business is tough for her husband, Yesenia can support him with the income from her painting business. 

Because of this, Yesenia wants to expand her business and purchase in bulk the products that she uses. She has attracted good customers who have requested more variety. 

With this requested loan, Yesenia can travel to the city of Monterrey to purchase more merchandise for her business, and can thus keep her business productive.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise.

loans.name: Ruzimoh

texts.en:
Ruzimoh is a plodding person who is married and has five children ages 19, 16, 14, 11 and 8. 

She has been busy with animal husbandry more than 5 years. With the passing of time, she has perfected her knowledge. She sells her animals in the local market. Thanks to the animals' good condition, she has managed to win a large quantity of customers for her business. Many of her customers are local butchers who like her work.

Ruzimoh is looking for a loan to buy young cattle. In this way she will be able to offer her customers good animals and continue to make financial progress, providing her household with good earnings. Each month she will make her payments on time. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Asha, a married mother of four children who are attending a local school. Her husband is a matatu (minibus) driver.

In 2010, Asha established her tailoring business to enable her to take care of her family. It is her only source of income. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, she earns about 10,000 KES every month. Now requesting a loan of 10,000 KES to buy clothing materials and sewing thread, Asha hopes to increase her monthly profits. In the future, she plans to open more businesses and educate her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy clothing materials and sewing thread

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for sewing business

loans.name: Oyun

texts.en:
Oyun lives with her husband and two children in a ger (Mongolian yurt)  in the Chingeltei district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her husband, Urtnasan, is 46 years old. He works in a food market. Her older son, Butbayar, is 19 years old. He is a college student. Her younger son, Otgonbayar, is 15 years old. He is a second school student. 

In 2011, Oyun graduated from a training center where she learned to produce camel wool hats and shirts. People purchase camel wool hats and shirts in the winter because they are good at conserving warmth, so Oyun started a camel wool hat and shirt production business in 2012. Now, she is making about 4 shirts a day and her two sons distribute the product to the market trader. Oyun is a hardworking and honest person. She needs 1,000,000 MNT to buy strings (wool yarn/thread) for her business.

loans.use: to buy strings (wool yarn/thread) for her business

loans.name: Helda

texts.en: Helda was very happy with his previous loan based on the achievement he made. He increased his stock and capital, and he says part of his children's school fees have been paid. Now Helda is happy to take another loan from Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase more items like sweets, Tox (for insects), pens and many other items

loans.name: Tsolmon

texts.en: Tsolmon is 22 years old and lives in an apartment in Dornogovi province, Mongolia. Her parents are deceased. She started her business selling clothes in 2012 with working capital of 1,000,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT). She is renting a rental counter in a senior shop. Tsolmon has retail experience from helping her older sister, who operates a clothes trading business. She is planning to increase her working capital. She is a hard-working and open-minded person. She is asking for a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to purchase more children's clothes for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more children's clothes for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Zagarsuren

texts.en: Zagarsuren is 22 years old and lives with her husband and her brothers in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. She is a college student. Her husband has a physical disability. Her parents are deceased. She is feeding her two younger brothers. Her younger brothers go to the secondary school. She started her own cafe business in July, 2012. Her husband and her younger brothers always help her. She is planning to expand her cafe business. She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase construction materials to repair her cafe. She is a good-hearted and hardworking woman. Zagarsuren 's goal is to increase the profit and to save the money for her husband and younger brothers to go to college.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to repair her cafe

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is married and has three children. He runs a very well-supplied small store, and he is a very hard-working and tenacious man always making efforts to get ahead in life.

Daniel told us he started working in this field more than two years ago because there was a need for a general store in his neighborhood, and little by little he has been able to grow thanks to his job. 

He is requesting a loan to buy more general products such as rice, noodles, flour, sugar, oil and baked products. Thanks to this investment he will keep on selling high quality products, consequently increasing his sales and his income.

loans.use: to buy more general products such as rice, noodles, flour, sugar, oil and baked products.

loans.name: Fairfax

texts.en:
Fairfax is a farmer in the Nkubu area of Central Kenya. He is aged 29 years but has been in farming since his teenage years. His farming activity produces cereal and stands as his main source of income although he also operates a retail shop in the local market.

Fairfax says a loan of 60,000 KES will help him buy poultry birds for a venture into poultry farming and help him diversify his farming business with a possibility of generating better income in all seasons. He says the poultry business would do well since it is not affected significantly by a lack of water. He aspires to eventually have a flock of 5,000 birds.

He adds that farming has become a good source of income to smallholder farmers.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is aged 51 years-old and has fifteen years experience in mixed farming in her rural hometown where she runs a retail business besides being an active farmer. She is married with two children aged 18 and 9 years. Her farm produces milk and cereal products for the local market.

Charity has requested this loan in order to buy a chuff cutter which will ease the feeding of her growing number of dairy cows. She says this will have a major impact since her feed will not go to waste and much of her time will not be wasted in feeding the animals.

She sees the high cost of inputs and inadequate rain are the main challenges she faces.

loans.use: to construct a zero grazing unit and buy a chuff cutter.

loans.name: Anggrek Indah 2 Group

texts.en:
Dewi is married and lives with her husband and two children. She sells goods from a catalogue including cosmetics, lotions and creams, powder, etc. She has been in this business for two years and has acquired quite a bit of experience that allows her to secure the best clientele and stay ahead of the competition. Her customers prefer her because she always has what they need at affordable prices and besides her customer service is good. 

Dewi is working hard to improve her children's living conditions, provide them with the best education, and to help her husband in covering their expenses. She is so excited at getting this loan, because she believes that the new items will make her customers happy.

Dewi is working hard to send her child to a favorite university in her city.

loans.use: to buy items from a cosmetic catalog including face powder, lipstick and eye shadow.

loans.name: Umaraly

texts.en:
Umaraly is a 23-year-old man. He is not married yet and lives with parents. He works at a TV company and has small salary. He wants to get married and is building a new house with modern design for his family but he does not have enough money to finish building it. 

This loan will help him buy building materials such as wood and cement for building the new house. In this way he will provide high-quality living conditions for his family and will put an end to the problems with the house.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as wood and cement to build a new house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry birds and build a cereals store.

loans.name: Suleiman

texts.en:
Sulaiman is aged thirty and has been in farming for ten uninterrupted years with bananas, cereals and milk being his main produce. He runs a retail shop as well. He is married with one child aged two years.

Sulaiman has made a loan request for 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy irrigation equipment to facilitate having an adequate water supply on his farm. He says this will ease management of his dairy cows and improve his milk output and his banana plantation which he wants to expand to three acres.

Sulaiman points out that pests and the high cost of labour pose the greatest challenges in the farming business.

loans.use: To buy irrigation equipment.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria, being a happy businessman, expresses his happiness for the previous loans in this way.  He has increased his operating capital, has started building his own house, and is now taking a new loan in order to support his business more by purchasing more items including sugar, rice, soap and cooking oil.  He is happy for Finance Sudan and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase more items including sugar, rice, soap, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more clothes for her women and kids retail clothing business.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence has been in farming for fifteen years in her rural home area where she lives with her two children aged ten and five. Farming is her main source of income although she also gets additional income from her retail shop in the local market.

Florence says that the acquisition of a 50,000 KES loan from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo will generate more income which she will use to educate her two children. She aspires to give her children a quality education. She also plans to expand her dairy farming significantly.

Florence commends Juhudi Kilimo for fast processing of loans.

loans.use: to construct a zero grazing unit and buy a chuffer cutter.

loans.name: Malika

texts.en:
Malika is 32 years old and she is not married. She sells men’s clothes to earn a living. She has been in the business for eight years. Through the financial support of the Imon international organization, she has managed to grow her business. 

She dreams of expanding her business and becoming prosperous in the future. She needs a loan of 2,200 USD to buy new variety of clothes for the new season. She looks for your help.

loans.use: To buy new variety of clothes for the new season.

loans.name: Eliphas

texts.en:
Eliphas is aged 34 and has seven years of experience in a farming business producing fruits and vegetables for the local market and which is the source of livelihood for his family of three children.

He has requested a loan of 40,000 KES and will use this amount to put up a zero grazing unit on his farm. He says he wants to give his children better education possibilities in better schools. He adds once his farming becomes stable he will move his children to better schools.

He says he chose Juhudi Kilimo for funding because of favourable repayment terms.

loans.use: To construct a zero grazing unit.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en: Christina is a young businesswoman who expresses her achievement from the previous loan as follows: she increased her business capital and restaurant and she has paid part of her children's school fees. Therefore she says she is happy for the support Finance Sudan is giving to her.

loans.use: to purchase more food items such as sugar, tea leaves and many others.

loans.name: Baby

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 39-year-old Baby from Kandeh town in the Southern area in Bo. She is married with four children between the ages of six and twenty. Her children are currently attending school. 

Baby runs a food stand business. She sells palm oil, rice, onions and gari. She has been running this business for 10 years. She works at the business from 6:00am until 7:30 pm, 6 days per week. Her other source of income come from small-scale farming at the back of the yard. Baby say her business is doing well, customers always wait for her to set-up her business because her house is close to the market.

Baby has requested a loan in order to buy more food stuff including palm oil, rice, onions and gari. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and improve her life. In the future, she would like her business to grow to become a shop. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more food stuffs including palm oil, rice, onions and gari.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a farmer with ten years of active commercial farming though her production level has always been limited due to lack of adequate capital. She produces milk, fruits and vegetables to meet her family's basic needs. She is married and three of her children are still schooling.

Janet says she will buy and insure a dairy cow with her loan facility. She will do good management of her dairy cows to ensure she fully repays the loan and so she can acquire bigger amounts. She believes in expanding both her dairy and banana-farming businesses.

She says failure of other crops and drought are the leading challenges.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith, 49, lives in West Point with four children between 18 and 25 years old. For five years now, she has been operating a cook shop (restaurant) in the market. She received a little amount from her husband to start her business and learned it from her mother. She likes her business because she makes a profit.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more bonnie fish, spareribs, rice, charcoal and pig feet for her business. Her plan is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more bonnie fish, spareribs, rice, charcoal and pig feet for her business.

loans.name: Krubo

texts.en:
Klubo, aged 50, works very hard  to provide for her family. She is a mother of five children between the ages of 12 and 31. Three of  the children live with her at West Point and attend school, while the other  two are independent. She is married to a businessman.

Klubo has been selling donuts and cool water for the past ten years. She started with a little income that she received from her husband. She is very proud of her business because with the profit she buys flour and cooking oil to improve her business and help her husband with the household expenses. 

She has requested this loan to purchase more cooking oil, flour for donuts, and mineral water for the business. Her plan for the future is to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, flour for donuts, and mineral water for her business.

loans.name: Akbarjon

texts.en:
Akbarjon is a very clever boy. He graduated school with excellence and good marks. He was one of the best pupils in his school. He likes literature, computers, law, math and other subjects. His hobby is watching TV. His classmates like him very much. 

This year he entered the Politics and Business University, in the Global Economics faculty. His parents are workers. Their income is small to pay for Akbarjon’s university studies. Akbarjon wants to be one of the best economists in his town. He is purposeful and hardworking. Please, help him to realize his dream. He is asking for a loan to pay for his university studies. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay for his university studies.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 35-year-old Elizabeth from Kandeh town Southern area in Bo. She is married with three children between the ages of three and seventeen years. Two of her children attend school. She began this business while she was doing catering training, but when her husband lost his job she decided to start a business 

Elizabeth runs a food stand business within a busy market area.  She sells dry fish, garden eggs (eggplant), pepper and Maggie cubes. She has been running this business for 7 years. She works at the business every day, 7 days per week. Her business is the only source of income she has. At present she is faced with a shortage of fish in the country.

Elizabeth has requested a loan in order to buy more dry fish, garden eggs, pepper and Maggie cubes. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and improve her living. In the future, she plans to build a house. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more dry fish, garden eggs, pepper and Maggie cubes.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en: Riziki lives in the coastal region of Kenya with her family; her husband and their five children. Her house is made of cement, but has no piped water; neither does it have electricity. She has a store in her house in which she stocks and sells makuti (thatching materials made from palm fronds). Once she came up with the idea of this business, she gradually made it into a reality thanks to her perseverance and effort. She works by herself every day without a fixed schedule, because she also must care for her family. She feels satisfied with her achievements because she has gotten ahead on her own, and this has helped her to gain the respect of her friends and neighbors who see in her an example to pass on to others. Riziki is requesting a loan to purchase more makuti for her store so that she can increase her sales. She expects to do this without any difficulties, and to continue working without any problems.

loans.use: to purchase more makuti for sale

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy, 45, lives in West Point. She is married and has eight children between 4 and 23 years old. 

For years now she has been operating a cook restaurant in the market. She learned it from her mother. She like her business because she makes a good profit.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more items like pepper, onion, rice, charcoal and oil for her business. Her plan is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more food items, charcoal and oil for her business.

loans.name: Erdenechimeg

texts.en:
Mrs. Erdenechimeg is 50 years old, and lives with her husband and son in a little house in Selenge province. Because of the proximity of Selenge province to the Russian border, she has been operating her clothes-trading business across the Russian border with her family for 20 years. She buys the clothes in Russia, then transports them in the car that she bought with a prior loan, and sells them in villages on the Mongolian side of the border. 

She is requesting a 5,000,000 MNT loan to buy a heating system for her house so that she can have better living conditions. She has previously borrowed money for her business and has paid her debt back on time.

loans.use: To buy a heating system for her house so she can have better living conditions.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick has been in active farming for ten years and currently sells milk, cereals, vegetables and fruits on the local market. He is married with two children aged eleven and one year. He earns additional income from employment.

Patrick has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a chuff cutter to ease the feeding of his dairy cows. He plans to build a decent house for his family with the farming income. He also plans to install a biogas system in his farm by making use of the dairy animal wastes at his disposal.

He says high cost of feeds and diseases management are the challenges in farming.

loans.use: To buy a chuff cutter.

loans.name: Jane Akello

texts.en:
Jane is a thirty-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has three children between the ages of three and ten, all of whom go to school. Jane runs a general store, and has been in business for three years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. 

She is taking a loan of 800 SDG to purchase clothes and many other items. Aside from this business, she has no other source of income. In five years Jane would like to expand her business. Her major challenges include high prices in the market. Jane says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan with the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more items such as clothes.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a resident of Murang’a and a single mother with two children aged three and four years. She has been in farming for twelve years and currently has a farm which produces beans, maize, cabbages, tea and pigs. She has one farmhand.

Lucy has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to boost her pig-farming business. She says this will improve her family's living standards and will help to expand her farming business.

She however notes drought and animal diseases are the main challenges.

loans.use: To buy piglets.

loans.name: Davaadorj

texts.en:
Mr. Davaadorj, 21 years old, lives with his wife in a ger in Hovd province of Mongolia. His wife operates a micro-business. Davaadorj and his father have been operating a taxi business using his father's car; Davaadorj is therefore an experienced taxi driver. 

Now he would like to start his own transportation business by purchasing a car. He needs 2,800,000 MNT to purchase a car to start his taxi service. He is a hard-working and honest man, who wants to make a better life for his wife and future family.

loans.use: To purchase a car to start his taxi service.

loans.name: Cosmas

texts.en:
Cosmas is a resident and a farmer in Nkubu area of Central Kenya, a region known for high production of khat and bananas. He has been in mixed farming for eight years, producing mainly bananas, cereals, milk and poultry. He runs a retail shop and a grocery business. He is married with one child aged four years.

Cosmas has requested a loan of 30,000 KES which he will use to buy poultry birds. He says he has skills in poultry business and that while there are challenges such as poultry diseases, high cost of labour and generally high cost of farming inputs he remains optimistic. He reiterates he will use the additional income to educate his child and improve his family's living standards.

He notes Juhudi Kilimo loan processing is very efficient.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Melkianus

texts.en:
Melkianus is a 57-year-old man; he is married to Agustina, a 56-year-old woman. They have been blessed with eight children: four are working and four are still attending school. Melkianus retired from a company last year. He was aware that as a retired man, the income generated would not fully cover the whole cost of living. It encouraged him to initiate two businesses: a rented house and a kiosk business. 

Even though Melkianus already has his own businesses he is still struggling to cover his children educational expenses. This situation then led Melkianus to improve his business by adding more stock to sell in his kiosk. To do so, Melkianus is requesting loan from TLM amounting to IDR 8,000,000. The loan will enable him to add more goods to his kiosk i.e. rice, sugar, coffee, wheat flour, mobile phone recharges etc. Melkianus is hoping that the loan will help him to improve his business.

loans.use: to add more goods to his kiosk such as rice, sugar, coffee, wheat flour and mobile phone recharges.

loans.name: Jacqueline Claudine

texts.fr: claudine est une femme de 34 ans célibataire, mère d'un enfant de 5 ans qui va déjà à l'école. Elle commerçante dans un marché de la place ou elle commercialise les vêtements depuis un ans. la bonne qualité de ses vêtements, ses prix abodables lui ont permis d'accroitre considérablement sa clientèle. C'est une activité qui rapporte mais la petitesse de son capital l'oblige à se ravitailler en détail et là, ça ne rapporte pas grand chose. pourtant c'est grace à cette activté qu'elle nourit sa petite famille. c'est pour cela qu'elle solliictze un crédit pour s'acheter un ballot de vêtement. ceci augmentera ses ventes et donc sa marge bénéficiaire. Une partie des ces bénéfices lui permettront de subvenir à ses besoins et le reste sera réinvesti dans osn commerce.
texts.en:
Claudine is a 34-year-old single woman.  She has a 5-year-old child who is already in school.

Claudine has been selling clothes for one year at a local market.  Because of the high quality and the reasonable price of the clothes that she sells, she has built a large customer base.

Although this type of activity is usually profitable, the fact that Claudine's capital is very small forces her to buy only retail quantities, which doesn't bring much profits.

However, it is thanks to this activity that she manages to feed her small family.

She is requesting a loan for the purchase of a bale of clothes.  This loan will allow her to increase her sales, and therefore her profit margin.

Part of her profits will be used to meet her needs, while the rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy a bale of clothes.

loans.name: Poni Betty

texts.en:
Poni is a thirty-three-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has two children aged four and eight, both of whom go to school. Poni runs a salon, and has been in business for three years. She has one employee. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. 

She is taking a loan of 800 SDG to purchase weaves and many other items. Aside from this business she has no other source of income. In five years Poni would like to expand her business. Her major challenges include high prices in the market. Poni says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan with the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more weaves and lotions.

loans.name: Alim

texts.en:
Alim lives in the Sabirabad region. He is 29 years old, married, and has one baby daughter. He has been in the cattle-breeding business for two years. Alim buys cattle, cares for them for more than three months and sells them in the local market. 

He want to buy more cattle to develop his business but he does not have enough money for it. That is why he requested the loan from Aqroinvest and Kiva. This is his first loan, and is for an amount of 600 AZN. He plans to buy two cattle. His dream is to have a better future for his family.

loans.use: to buy two cattle.

loans.name: Rustamjon

texts.ru: Рустамчону 40 лет. Он женат на прекрасной женщине Малохат, которая помогает ему в ведении бизнеса. Он владелец кафе, где готовит и продает гамбургер, хотдог и другие булочные изделия. На воспитании Рустамчон имеет троих детей. Его дети учатся в университете и в школе. Его старший сын Бахтиер студент 1 курса Таджикского Государственного Университета Политики и Бизнеса. Бахтиер очень способный молодой человек, он успешно учился в средней школе, поступил в университет и помогает родителям в приготовлении гамбургеров. Рустамчон запрашивает кредит для оплаты учебы сына в университете. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Rustamjon is 40 years old. He is married to a wonderful woman, Malohat, who helps him run his business. He is the owner of a cafe, where he cooks and sells hamburgers, hotdogs, and оther baked goods. 

Rustamjon raises three children who study at university and school. His oldest son, Bahtier, is a freshman at the Tajik State University of Politics and Business. Bahtier is a very capable young man: he finished high school with great grades, got accepted to university, and also helps his parents cooking hamburgers. Rustamjon is requesting this loan to pay for his son's university studies. He is hoping for your kindness!

loans.use: To pay for university study

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en:
Winfred has fifteen years experience in mixed farming with the income generated being the only source of income for her family of two children aged thirteen and ten years. Her major produce is vegetables.

Winfred has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a water tank and water pipes which will help with the supply of water on the farm both for her animals and her vegetable farming. She says this will mitigate the challenge of inadequate rains and provide the income she needs to educate her two children.

She adds that once the water problem is resolved, she will supply her produce to distant markets which fetch better prices.

loans.use: To buy a water tank and water pipes

loans.name: Bintiali

texts.en:
Bintiali is 38-year-old divorced woman with six children, only two of whom attend school. They live in their own house that is thatched with makuti (palm fronds) and which has mud walls.

Bintiali has been selling makuti as retail to the neighborhood from her home. She says that it has been a profitable business; thanks to it she has been able to provide for her children. Thanks to the sale of these makuti, she can cover her household expenses. She’s been in this business since last year. 

This is her second loan with Yehu and she promises that she will make her installment payments punctually. She will use the requested 20,000 KES to buy more makuti for sale. She is a determined mother despite the fact that she struggles alone to satisfy household needs.

loans.use: to buy more makuti to sell.

loans.name: Joyce Mambo

texts.en:
Joyce is a thirty-one-year-old business woman who lives in Juba. She is married and has two children aged three and seven both of whom go to school. Joyce runs a drinks-selling business, and has been in business for four years. She has one employee. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. 

She is taking a loan of 800 SDG to purchase sodas, beers and other products. Aside from this business, she has no other source of income. In 5 years Joyce would like to expand her business and open a bar. Her major challenges include high prices in the market. Joyce says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan with the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more items such as sodas, beers and water.

loans.name: Bargigul

texts.ru:
Баргигул жительница города Дангара. Ей 37 лет. Она замужем. У нее шестеро детей. Ее дети учатся в средней школе. Она на протяжении четырех лет занимается торговлей. У Баргигул на сегодняшний день имеется собственный продуктовый магазин, где она работает продавцом. 
Баргигул просит кредит для покупки зерновых и зернобобовых культур. Она старается увеличить ассортимент и товарооборот, чтобы клиенты не утруждая себя могли найти необходимые продукты. Баргигул нуждается в вашей поддержке.
texts.en:
Bargigul is a 37-year-old woman living in the city of Dangara. She is married and has six children in high school. 

Bargigul has worked in trade for four years. She currently has her own small grocery store, where she works as the saleswoman. She is requesting this loan to buy grains and legumes. She is trying to improve the variety of goods and their turnover so that her clients can find essential products without trouble. Bargigul is in need of your help!

loans.use: to purchase grains and legumes

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet 30-year-old Famata from Kandeh town, Southern area of Bo, Sierra Leone. She is married with two children aged two and six. One of her children currently attends school. In 2000, Fatmata established her plastic and rubber business. She began her business because her parents taught her business; she did not go to school. She works at the business every day expect holidays. Her husband is a driver but his income is not enough to support her family. She says that the main challenge for her business is insufficient capital to run her business.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to buy more buckets, food containers and plates. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to give her children quality education. In the future, Fatmata plans to open a shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more buckets, food containers and plates.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.fr: Jacqueline est une femme agée de de 52 ans, divorcée et mère de de 4 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 15 et 30 ans, l'un de ses enfants est encore scolarisé.elle est couturière et exerce son activté depuis 30 ans dans un quartier de la capitale. la qualité  de ses services et son expérience dans ce domaine lui ont permis de fideliser une clientèle.Elle sollicite un crédit pour acheter un rouleau de tissu parce que son capital alui seul ne peut pas le lui permettre. ceci afin de satisfaire sa clientèle grandissante, d'augmenter ses ventes et ses bénéfices. Elle réinvestira une partie de ses bénéfice dans on activté  et le reste l'aidera à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille
texts.en: Jacqueline is a 52-year old woman, who is divorced and mother to four children ranging from 15 to 30 years old. One of her children is still at school. She is a dressmaker and has been carrying out this activity for the past 30 years in one of the capital's districts. The quality of her services and her experience in this field have enabled her to build up a loyal customer base. She is requesting a loan to buy a roll of fabric, because her capital alone is not sufficient to do so. She is doing this in order to be able to satisfy her growing customer base, to increase her income and her profits.
