loans.use: to purchase more chicken feet, pig feet, etc for her food business.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa cooks waakye (rice and beans cooked together) for sale at Breman near Abura  She serves it with gari, macroni, meat and fish stew.   Yaa has been selling wakye and rice for the past three years now.  She is married to a farmer and has five children.  Yaa assists her husband in paying their children’s school fees.  Her loan will be used to purchase bags of rice, beans and fish to prepare her waakye for sale.  Yaa will use her new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice, beans and fish to prepare her waakye for sale.

loans.name: Korpo

texts.en: Korpo lives in Jacobs Town. At 24 years old, she is married and has two children, aged 8 and 13,. For the past ten years, Korpo has been selling chicken, chicken feet, pig's feet and spare ribs in the local market. She started this business with help from her husband. She is requesting a loan to purchase more chicken, chicken feet, pig's feet and spare ribs for her business. She enjoys her popularity. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more chicken, chicken feet, pig's feet and spare ribs for her food business.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Edith lives in Jacobs Town. At 48 years old, she is married and her husband is a contractor. They have three children between 9 and 26 years old. For the past twenty years, Edith has been selling charcoal in the market. She started this business with money given to her by her husband. She learned this way of selling from her friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. Her plan is to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca, age 44, earns her living by selling fufu (grain cassava), a traditional African food made from cassava, at the local market. She and her husband have six children between the ages of eight and 22 years old. The family lives in Jacobs Town. The children are enrolled in school, and the youngest lives at home while the others live with their grandmother. 

Rebecca started her business with her savings and has operated it for the past 20 years. She enjoys the independence she gains through running her venture but tells us that sometimes business is slow.

She is requesting a loan a to purchase more fufu to offer for sale.

loans.use: to purchase more fufu (grain cassava) to offer for sale

loans.name: Soway

texts.en: Sowary is a University student. Sowary is single and has a child who is in school. Sowary has been selling used clothes for the past three years. She learned to sell from her aunt. Her favorite part of the business is the interaction with people. She makes her profit when she sells. She uses the profit to improve the business and meet up with the needs of her child. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for the business. Her future plan is to build house.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for the business.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 59 years old. She lives in the village of Kvishilori. Marina is a widow and lives with her 18-year-old son. 

Marina requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for an agricultural business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time because of her low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is a pig. Marina sells on average 10 piglets per year in the village. The monthly income of the family is 200 GEL, which is even less than the minimum living wage estimated in the country. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Marina requested a loan from Credo to start a dairy farm. Her loan request was approved in the frame of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit, Marina will purchase a milk cow and a calf. She will place the domestic animals in an old cattle-shed located in their yard. Marina will produce cheese from the milk and sell it in the village. After a year, the calf will grow and turn into a milk cow. Marina will double the cheese production at that time. 

The new business initiative, financed through the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly increase the income of the family. Their income will double and the family members will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow and a calf.

loans.name: Mwachi

texts.en:
Mwachi is now 52 years old and still a fish monger in Mombasa. His six children are still doing well in school and his business is doing well and he has no complaints. 

This marks his second business loan from KADET Ltd. He plans to use the loan to purchase more Tilapia, Nile perch fish, prawns and sardines to resell to his customers. The anticipated profits will be used to buy more stock of fish and repay his loan. 

He hopes to realize more profits from the sales and thus be able to expand his business further.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish for selling.

loans.name: Garmia

texts.en:
Garmia is 25 years old lives in the Jacob Town area. She is married with two children, ages 8 and 12, who live at home and attend school. For the past ten years, she has been involved in the sale of alcoholic drinks. Her main problem is the location of her shop. 

Rebecca started this business with the help of her husband. She says what she likes about this business is that it helps her to take care of children. She is requesting a loan to purchase more alcoholic drinks for her business. She wishes to build her own house.

loans.use: to purchase more alcoholic drinks for her business.

loans.name: Opherlia

texts.en:
Ophelia lives in Jacobs Town. At 34 years old, she is married and her husband is a driver. They have three children between 2 months and 16 years of age. For the past year she has been involved in baking bread and cake in her community. She started this business from her savings and learned this trade from a school from which she graduated. 

Ophelia is requesting a loan to purchase butter, flours, sugar, brown sugar, and others items for her business. Her plan is to expand her business and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase butter, flours, sugar, brown sugar, and others items for her business.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 39-year-old Joseph from Moriba Town, in the southern area of Bo. He is married with three children between the ages of 8 and 14 years old. His children attend school. Joseph left school at secondary level and started doing hard labor.

Joseph runs an electrical appliance store, where he sells extension cords, electrical cable, sockets, lamp holders and bulbs. He has been running this business for ten years. He works at the business 13 hours a day and seven days a week. His other source of income comes from his wife who is a business woman. Joseph says that the main challenge to his business is insufficient capital to expand his business.

Joseph has requested a loan in order to buy more extension cords, electrical cable, sockets, lamp holders and bulbs. The extra income from this loan will allow him to educate his children and improve his family's welfare. In the future, he plans to open a bigger store. He thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more extension cords, electrical cable, sockets, lamp holders and bulbs.

loans.name: Mutindi

texts.en:
Mutindi is a 50-year-old businesswoman and is widowed with three children. She has been selling clothes as a primary business and running a green grocery as a secondary business for the past three years, and gets a monthly income of KES 20,000, which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her first loan term with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Mutindi will use the loan to purchase more inventory of clothes, which she will sell at a profit. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. 

She hopes to open a boutique shop in future.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory of clothes.

loans.name: Peterson

texts.en:
Peterson is a 31-year-old business man, married to Faith, and they are blessed with one child. Peterson has been operating a cereals outlet business and has been engaged in polythene vending for the past six years. He is able to get a monthly income of KES 15,260, which he uses to support his family. 

Peterson is applying for first loan with KADET and he plans to use the loan to buy more inventory of polythene papers for his vending business. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his child. 

He hopes to have good business and a better, healthy family.

loans.use: to buy more inventory of polythene papers for his vending business.

loans.name: Neijay

texts.en:
Neijay is 40 years old and lives in Paynesville South Area. She is married and has four children, ages 6 to 24. The children are currently in school and live at home. 

For three years, Neijay has been operating a cook shop (restaurant) in the local market. She makes lots of profit and has many customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, pepper and oil for her business. She hopes to build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper and oil for her business.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena is married with six children. For the past two years, she has been buying fresh fish to smoke and sell. Abena uses her income to support her husband to feed and clothe their children.  

Abena is requesting a loan to purchase fresh fish to smoke and sell. She will use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish to smoke and sell

loans.name: Abaawa Hagar Group

texts.en:
Saluwa is twenty-nine years old. She is married and has one child. She lives with her family at Effiakuma in the western region. She sells beverages and fried eggs and bread. She does her business in the mornings, since most working people would want to take their breakfast before going to work. 

Saluwa wants a loan to expand the size of her tea shop and also to purchase more boxes of milo, milk, sugar and crates of eggs. She hopes to increase her profit margin to enable her to save more to support her family, especially her children's education. She belongs to a trust bank group called ‘Premium’. The group members guarantee for one another as collateral to access the loan.

loans.use: to purchase stock.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba is married to a farmer and has three children. For the past two years, she has run a grocery shop at Bereman, near Abura, where she sells milk, Milo, sugar, soup, different kinds of soft drinks, tinned tomatoes and fish, biscuits, toffees, powdered milk, and kenkey. Aba uses her income to support her husband in the general upkeep of their home.

Aba is requesting a loan to purchase a variety of grocery items to satisfy her customers. She will use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to purcahse a variety of grocery items to satisfy her customers

loans.name: Adowa

texts.en:
Adowa earns a living by extracting palm oil and kennel oil to offer for sale. She lives and works in Breman, near Abura. 

Adowa uses her income to help her husband pay their children’s school fees.  

She will use her loan to purchase palm fruit and palm kennel from which to extract oil to offer for sale. With the expected profit, she intends eventually to buy a machine for her business.

loans.use: to purchase palm fruit and palm kennel from which to extract oil to offer for sale

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua is a food vender; she cooks rice for sale.  She serves it with vegetables, fish and meat stew at Bremang near Abura.  She is married and has five children.  Her husband is a farmer.  

Akosua has been selling rice for five years.  She uses her income to assist her husband for the general upkeep of their family.  She will use her loan to buy bags of rice to cook and then sell at her food stall.  She hopes to use the new profits from her expanded business to build a better food stall.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice to cook and then sell at her food stall.

loans.name: Teaze

texts.en:
Teaze is 49 years old. She is married and has seven children, aged between 10 and 25 years old. They all live at Congo town. She has been selling coal for the past ten years in her community where she has her coal warehouse. 

Teaze started by selling with the little income that she receive from her husband. She likes this kind of business because, she makes a profit every day. With the profit, she helps her husband with the home and she buys more coal to sell.

Teaze is requesting a loan to purchase more coal for the business. Her plan for the future is to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more coal for the business.

loans.name: Albertine

texts.fr: albertine est une femme âgée de 51 ans, mariée et mère d'un enfants âgé de 28 ans.elle a également 02 autres personnes à sa charge.elle est commerçante et exerce son activité depuis03 ans dans un quartier de la capitale.Son acceuil,son respect envers la clientèle et son enthousiasme lui ont permis d'acquerir une clientèle considérable qu' elle n'arrive plus à satisfaire à cause de la rupture permanente des stocks.Elle sollicite un crédit pour augmenter ses stocks de marchandises afin de satisfaire la clientèle exigente.Les bénéfices issus l'aideront à réinvestir dans son activité et répondre aux besoins de sa famille
texts.en:
Albertine is a 51-year-old woman who is married and the mother of a 28-year-old.  She also has two other dependents.  Albertine is a businesswoman who has been active for three years in the region of the capital. Her amiability, her respect for the customers and her enthusiasm have enabled her to acquire a substantial customer base.

However, she can no longer meet their demand due to an ongoing lack of inventory.  She is requesting a loan so that she can increase her inventory of merchandise and satisfy the demand of her customers.  The income she receives will help Albertine to reinvest in her business as well as meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase crates of bottled drinks

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Maame  is a petty trader. She trades in ladies' and children's dress and underwear, which she has done for 3 years. Maame  is married to a carpenter and has 5 children. They live at  Breman, near Abura. Maame uses her income to help her husband in paying their utility bills. Maame will use her loan to purchase additional ladies' and children's wear to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Maame wishes to acquire a shop from which to sell her goods.

loans.use: to purchase ladies' and children's wear to sell.

loans.name: Peaceful God Group

texts.en:
Agnes, age 42, trades in maize and yam to earn her living. She believes in hard work and commitment as the primary solution to reducing poverty and she is very serious about her business. She has been trading for the past 20 years and the business has proved to be very beneficial for her family. She and her husband have three children.  

She intends to use her loan funds to buy larger supplies of maize and yam tubers to offer to her customers. 

Agnes is a member of a trust group called Peaceful God. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral and provide support for themselves to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy larger supplies of maize and yam tubers to offer to her customers

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa operates a chop bar (where a variety of African dishes are sold) this she has done for the past two years.  The food she serves includes fufu, banku, meat, soup, fish soup and rice balls.  

Yaa is married and has four children.  Yaa uses her income to support her husband pay their children’s school fees.  She will use her loan to purchase  maize, cassava, meat, fish and other ingredient to prepare food for sale.  With the new profit from her expanded business Yaa plans to open a resturant.

loans.use: to purchase maize, cassava, meat, fish and other ingredient to prepare  food for sale.

loans.name: Fuerza Divina 2 Group

texts.en:
Trinidad is the coordinator of her group, Fuerza Divina (Divine Force) 2. This group is located in Hato Mayor, a rural town where the economy is based around agriculture. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her two children.

Trinidad sells groceries from her colmado, or grocery shop. She went into business using her savings, setting up a stall in her house to sell groceries. Her colmado prospered as the years passed. Almost a year ago she went to Esperanza and took out a loan that made it possible for her to invest a greater amount in her shop and so earn more in profits.

Trinidad is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan. She is planning to use her portion of this 145,000 DOP loan to buy rice, beans, sugar, flour, canned goods and other inventory. She will reinvest her profits in her desire to see her colmado succeed. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy groceries to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph runs a green grocer business in the Kongowea area of Coast province, Kenya. He has been operating his business for two years. For additional income, Joseph owns a salon and a transport vehicle. He uses his income to support his wife and their two children. 
 
He learned about Milango through a friend who invited him to the group, and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. 

Joseph is applying for a loan of 93,850 Kenya shillings, which he will use to buy fruits and vegetables in wholesale. His extra income will be added to his savings to improve the living standards of his family. 

He aspires to expand his business and to build up a transport business by buying a public service van.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables in wholesale.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella owns and operates a green grocer business in the Mariakani area of Coast province, Kenya. She has run her business for three years. She and her husband have four children. 

She learned about Milango through a friend who invited her to the group, and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are price fluctuations, inflation, and purchasing stock.

Stella is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to purchase retail stock, such as sugar and flour, for her shop. Her extra income will be added to her savings to grow her business. 

She aspires to open another green grocer and also to build a rental house.

loans.use: to purchase retail stock, such as sugar and flour, for her shop

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is 34 years old, married to Joseph, and they are blessed with two children. Her husband supports her in the upkeep of the family. 

She operates a mobile phone and electronics shop and has been in this business for three years, earning a monthly income of KES 15,250 from it.

This is her first loan with KADET Ltd. and she plans to use the loan to buy more stock of items like phones, earphones, and heaters, which she will later resell at a profit. She plans to use the anticipated profit to buy a piece of land for horticultural farming.

loans.use: To buy more stock of items like phones, earphones and heaters.

loans.name: La Buena Fe 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Yusleny is the coordinator of her group, La Buena Fe (Good Faith) 1, 2 & 3. This group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, where the sugarcane harvest and tourist industry dominate the economy. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her longtime partner and three children.

Yusleny has been selling household goods for almost five years. She started out with a small sum her partner gave her. She says that her most difficult challenges are selling her products on credit and then collecting on them. Despite these difficulties she continues to enjoy doing business.

Yusleny is excited to be taking out her sixth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use her portion of this 197,000 DOP loan to buy more goods to sell, especially household and cosmetic products.

Yusleny will use her profits to invest in her business and to cover some family expenses. She thanks you all for your support!!!

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell.

loans.name: Hanneh

texts.en: Hanneh is 34 years old, married, and has a son that is six years old. She is a high school student and lives at West Point. Her husband is a driver. For the past two years she has been selling soft drinks, juice, stout, beer, and gin. She started with money that she received from her husband, and she learned to sell from her friend. She likes this business because she is able to make a profit. With her profits, she buys more drinks and helps her husband with the family's expenses. She has requested this loan to purchase more soft drinks, stout, beer, and gin for the business. Her plan for the future is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks, stout, beer, and gin

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma runs a retail business in the Mariakani area of Coast province, Kenya. She has run her business for three years. She and her husband have six children. 

She learned about Milango through a friend who invited her to the group, and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are customers not paying on time, high fuel expenses, and transport costs.

Mwanajuma is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to buy sugar, wheat flour, and groundnuts in wholesale. Her extra income will be added to her savings. 

She aspires to open a wholesale shop and become a supplier in the area.

loans.use: to buy sugar, wheat flour and groundnuts in wholesale

loans.name: Makarimoul Akhlakh Groupe 3

texts.fr:
Le groupement d’intérêt  économique  dénommé GIE MAKARIMAL AKHLAH est né le 10 octobre 2003 au Sénégal. Le terme   Makarimal Akhlakh symbolise une personne qui a un bon cœur,  de bonnes pratiques. Le GIE  a atteint le nombre de 300 adhérents depuis  2009. Son objectif est d’unir ses membres et de leur permettre d’exercer des activités de production agricole et halieutique, de commerce général d’import export et de transport, d’industrie, d’artisanat, de bâtiments , d’élevage, d’exploitation minière, de pêche, d’exploitation d’hydrocarbures, d’art  et de culture, d’imprimerie et de menuiserie bois, de services et d’action d’utilité publique, de représentation, de transformation de produits halieutiques, d’agriculture , de vente de pièces détachées, de fabrique de glace , de boulangerie et de prestations de services divers. Le GIE vise aussi a consolider des liens d’amitié et de solidarité entre ses membres pour leur permettre d’acquérir des moyens matériels et financiers nécessaires au développement de leurs activités génératrices de revenus et de bénéficier de tous les avantages liés au GIE. Et c’est dans cette mouvance qu’un protocole d’accord a été signé entre le GIE et UIMCEC  au bénéfice  des membres du GIE au niveau national. La première phase  a porté sur  un échantillon de 120 membres actifs divisés en 12 groupes de 10. 
Makarimal Akhlakh groupe 3 est composé de 10 membres  du GiE qui exerce la meme activité. Ils sont représentés par madame Marietou B. C’est une femme divorcée qui   s’adonne depuis plus de 10 ans  à la vente de tissus, de produits de mercerie et divers autres articles. Elle commence sa journée de travaille a 9 heures, le matin et rentre a 17 heures. Elle est sociétaire a l’UIMCEC et sollicite un crédit prévu pour l’achat de tissus et d’articles divers dans le but de renforcer son stock  de marchandises. L’accroissement  de ses bénéfices lui permettra de prendre en charge les frais  scolaires  de ses enfants mais aussi d’épargner de l’argent. Son rêve est de devenir une très grande commerçante  qui voyage a travers les plus pays commerciaux du monde pour faire de import-export.
texts.en:
This borrowers’ group, named Gie Makarimal Akhlakh, was created on October 10, 2003 in Senegal. The term “Makarimal Akhlakh” denotes a person has a good heart and does the right thing. Since 2009, the number of group members has reached 300. The goal is to unify group members helping them with their work:  farming, fishing, general retail, import/export, transportation, industry, crafts, construction, animal husbandry, mining, [fishing], arts and culture, printing and woodwork, public services, sales, processing seafood and produce, retailing spare parts, ice cream production, bakeries and providing various services. The GIE also aims to foster friendship and solidarity among its members so as to help them acquire the material and financial means necessary for their businesses and to take advantage of the benefits afforded by GIE. It is in this spirit that an agreement has been signed between GIE and UIMCEC, to benefit GIE members at the national level. The launching phase uses a sample of 120 active members divided into 12 groups with 10 people in each.

Makarimal Akhlakh-group 3 is composed of 10 GIE members who are in the same line of business. They are represented by Mrs. Marietou B.  She is a divorced woman who has been selling fabric, sewing supplies and other miscellaneous items for over 10 years. She starts her work day at 9 AM and finishes at 5 PM. She is a member of UIMCEC and is seeking a credit to replenish her stock by buying fabric and miscellaneous items. The growth of her revenue will allow her to cover the cost of her children’s tuition and also  save money. Her dream is to become a large-scale entrepreneur and travel to   big industrial countries around the world to conduct import-export transactions.

loans.use: to buy fabric and miscellaneous supplies for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy men's and women's clothing items to offer for sale

loans.name: Rama

texts.en:
Rama owns and operates a video café. He started his business with his own savings. He is unmarried and lives in the Likoni area of Coast province, Kenya.

He learned about Milango through friends who invited him to the group, and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve the operation of the business. The primary challenges he faces are taxes and purchasing stock.

Rama is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings to buy a projector and a bigger television. The extra income expected from the loan will be added to his savings.

His future plan is to build a rental house.

loans.use: to buy a projector and a bigger television for his video café

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is a tailor. She has owned and operated her tailoring shop business for three years. She lives in the Mariakani area of Coast province, Kenya, with her husband and their two children.

She learned about Milango through a friend who invited her to the group, and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are customers not paying on time and purchasing stock.

Doris is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to buy sewing threads and materials. Her extra income will be added to her savings to expand her business. 

She aspires to open a wholesale shop for school uniforms.

loans.use: to buy sewing threads and materials.

loans.name: Dama

texts.en: Dama lives in the Kongowea area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has eight children, of whom two attend school. She owns a retail shop and a green grocery, businesses she has been operating for 12 years. She also owns a farming business where she earns a salary. She learned about Milango through a friend who invited her to our group, and she joined with the idea of accessing credit to improve her business operations. The challenges she faces include price fluctuations and inflation. Dama is applying for a loan for 22,000 Kenya shillings to buy vegetables and cooking oil. She will add the extra income made possible by this loan to her savings to improve the living standard of her family. Her plan for the future is to own a wholesale shop and be a supplier.

loans.use: to buy vegetables wholesale and cooking oil to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Mario Ernesto

texts.es: Don Mario tiene 66 años de edad, es casado, tiene dos hijos, vive con su esposa y una hija en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Hace más de 6 años que don Mario se independizo con su propio negocio de elaboración de trapeadores. Este producto lo vende en los mercados locales. Anteriormente trabajo en una maquila donde adquirió mucha experiencia. El está solicitando el quinto préstamo a ODEF,que es por 11,500 Lempiras para comprar hilos para fabricar trapeadores. Espera mejorar las ventas y sus ganancias, siendo su meta ampliar el negocio y tener toda la maquinaria para trabajar.
texts.en: Mario, 66, is married and has two children; he lives with his wife and daughter in the town of Choloma, Cortes.  He started his own mop-making business six years ago.  He sells these products in the local markets.  He used to work in an assembly plant where he acquired much experience.  He’s asking ODEF for his fifth loan in the amount of 11,500 Lempiras to buy threads to manufacture mops.  He hopes to improve sales and profits his goal being to expand the business and have all the necessary machinery to do his work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to manufacture mops.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther sells maize porridge and bread. She also operates a grocery shop at Besease near Elmina. The items in her grocery shop are milk, milo, sugar, soups, different kinds of soft drinks, tin tomatoes, tin fish, biscuits, toffees, powdered milk, etc. Esther is married to a farmer and has five children. She has been in this business for 15 years now. She uses her income to support her family by paying utility bills. Esther will use her loan to purchase maize, flour, and a variety of grocery items to sell. With the new profit Esther will expand her business.

loans.use: purchase maize, flour, and other grocery items to sell

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel owns a carpentry workshop, a business he has been operating for 14 years. In his shop, Samuel builds and sells such items as doors, tables, and beds. Samuel lives with his wife and their school-going child in the Kongowea area of Coast province, Kenya.

He learned about Milango through a friend who invited him to the group, and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. The primary challenge he faces is competition from other carpenters.

Samuel is applying for a loan of 73,050 Kenya shillings to buy timber for the business. The extra income expected from the loan will be added to his savings to improve the living standards of his family. 

His plan for the future is to become a supplier of timber.

loans.use: to buy timber for his carpentry business

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana María de  65 años de edad, del municipio del viejo, soltera sin hijos, tiene por actividad económica un taller de costura, en el cual se ha desempeñado desde hace 40 años, este negocio surgió por la necesidad de tener un medio de trabajo, ya que estaba sin trabajo fijo y no podía tener ingresos, y gracias a su espíritu de emprendedora y sus ganas de salir adelante es que decide  realizar trabajo de costura con los conocimientos  y los herramientas de trabajo que era la máquina de coser, conocimientos que ya  había adquirido de su mama, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. Ana María ella se encuentra muy satisfecha con la actividad económica que realiza porque atreves de ella ha podido subsistir económicamente, su negocio consisten en la elaboración de prendas de vestir como: ropa de vestir variada para damas y caballeros, elaboración de cobertores, fundas, protectores de tapas de inodoros, pantalones, faldas entre otros. Ana maría se encuentra muy agradecidos con los prestatarios kiva porque gracias a su ayuda es que ha podido salir adelante con los encargos realizados por sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ana María, 65, is from El Viejo.  She’s single and has no children.  Her economic activity is a sewing workshop she’s been working in for the last 40 years.  This business arose because she needed to have a source of employment because she had no steady job and had no income.  Thanks to her enterprising spirit and her desire to get ahead, she decided to start sewing applying her skills and the work tools she had which was a sewing machine.  She’d acquired the knowledge from her mother and her business is located at home.

Ana María is very satisfied with the economic activity she carries out because she’s been able to subsist economically by means of it.  Her business consists in making articles of clothing like various clothes for men and women, making comforters, pillow cases, toilet seat covers, pants, skirts, etc.  Ana María is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she’s been able to get ahead with her pending customer orders.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: Roberto e 35 años de edad vive en el corregimiento de Salgar, municipio de Puerto Colombia, ubicado a orillas del mar. Después de producir diariamente deditos de quesos fritos, apoyado por su cónyuge y desde muy temprano,  Roberto los distribuye en 30 tiendas del municipio y con el producto de sus ventas genera ingresos con los cuales responde a los gastos de su hogar. Una vez su esposa produce,  Robero distribuye desde las 5 de la mañana en su motocicleta. Adicionalmente vende carne de res, cerdo, frutas y queso, que le envían desde un municipio lechero en el departamento del Magdalena. Estos últimos productos también los ofrece en las tiendas y principalmente en los hogares del corregimiento, donde lo identifican y muchos son los clientes que ha conseguido. Roberto ha recibido hace un año un financiamiento de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual  ha logrado incrementar sus ventas en un 20%, también ha logrado invertir en la terminación de su vivienda y esto lo hace muy feliz. Su meta más adelante es abrir un local al público y agregarle además de sus productos, ranchos, víveres, y artículos de la canasta familiar, para finalmente terminar de hacer adecuaciones locativas a su vivienda. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, segundo financiamiento que hace a la Fundación y con el cual comprara un congelador, para aumentar su capital de trabajo y financiar las ventas  de carnes ofreciendo crédito a sus clientes y ampliándose a un mercado que así lo requiere para finalmente lograr aumentar el volumen de sus ventas. Mientras esto ocurre maneja una rotación de inventarios de 4 días y un margen de utilidades del 32%,  indicadores financieros desde donde se proyecta el crecimiento de su negocio.
texts.en: Robert at 35 years old, lives in Salgar corregimiento in the town of Puerto Colombia, located on the shores of the sea. Helped by his wife very early every day to produces fried cheese fingers, Robert then distributes them to 30 stores in the town. His sales generate the earnings he uses to pay household expenses. Once his wife makes them, Roberto distributes them beginning at 5 a.m. on his motorcycle. He also sells beef, pork, fruits and cheese, which are sent to him from a dairy town in the department of Magdalena. He also sells these products to stores and principally to homes in his corregimiento where people know him and he has attracted many customers. Roberto received funding from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo a year ago, with which he succeeded in increasing sales 20%. He also invested in completing his dwelling and this makes him very happy. His future goal is to open a shop to the public and add to it, in addition to his current products, meals, food and items in the typical family shopping basket, so that he can finally finish making on-site adjustments to his house. Currently he is applying for a Kiva loan, his second funding from the Fundación, and will use it to buy a freezer in order to increase his working capital and finance the sale of meat by offering credit to his customers and expanding a market that needs credit, so that he can finally increase his volume of sales. While this is happening, he is managing a 4 day turnover in his inventory and a profit margin of 32%, the financial indicators from which he projects his business growth.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer and to increase his working capital and finance his meat sales.

loans.name: Pablo De Jesus

texts.es: Pablo tiene 39 años de edad, es casado y  tiene 6 hijos, su esposa se dedica a la venta de abarrotería, uno de sus hijos trabaja en una tienda y un varón se dedica a la ganadería, los demás hijos se dedican a estudiar. Don Pablo inicio su negocio desde hace 14 años el  se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería, la finca de café la trabaja de forma personal, y cuando es temporada de corte del grano de café todos sus hijos y su esposa le ayudan a realizar el trabajo, la ventaja que tiene en la venta de café es que el precio es bueno y le deja muy buenas ganancias. Con el préstamo que solicita don Pablo, lo invertirá en la compra de abono y para poder chapear la finca. Con el apoyo de este préstamo le ayudaría mucho ya que con el abono la cosecha de café será mayor y por consiguiente habrá mas ingresos en la familia. Los desafíos que enfrenta es la competencia. Los sueños de don pablo es tener una finca mas grande y bonita. Este es su primer préstamo en FAMA y espera cancelar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Pablo, 39, is married and has six children.  His wife sells groceries and one of his children works in a store and another one works raising cattle; his other children are students.  Pablo started his business 14 years ago.  He works in agriculture and raising cattle.  He works his coffee plantation himself and when it’s time to cut the beans all his children and his wife help him do the work.  The advantage he has is that coffee prices are good and he earns very good profits.

With the requested loan Pablo will buy manure and will be able to do the weeding.  With help from this loan he will be greatly helped with manure and the coffee harvest will be larger thus producing more family income.  His challenge is competition.  His dreams are to have a larger, beautiful farm.  This is his first FAMA loan and he expects to make his payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy manure and pay to do the weeding.

location.town: San Francisco de la Paz, Olancho

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wholesale fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and employ skilled labor for harvest

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes, shoes and artificial flowers to sell.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel lives in Changamwe, Kenya. He is married and has three children, two of whom are in school. He earns his living as a milk supplier, a trade he was introduced to by friends at Milango. He is applying for a loan for 41,850 Kenyan shillings to buy milk to sell. He looks forward to owning a place from which he can sell milk despite the challenge of some clients not paying on time. Daniel will use the extra income made possible by this loan to pay for his children's school fees. He dreams of owning a milk depot in the future.

loans.use: to buy milk to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Agathe

texts.fr: Agathe est une femme de 45 ans mariée mère de 5 enfants dont l'age varie entre 13 et 25 ans. Deux de ses enfants vont encore à l'école, elle a aussi deux autres personnes à sa charge. Elle est couturière et a ouvert un atelier de couture depuis 3 ans déjà dans lequel elle fait la confection des sacs scolaires dans un quartier de la capitale. son activté rapporte plus pendant les rentrées scolaires parce que le sac est un outils important pour les élèves. C'est pour cela qu'elle sollicte ce crédit pour s'acheter un roulaux  de tissus et le matériel de couture pour la confection  des sacs. ceci augmentera sa production, et donc ses ventes ainsi que ses bénéfices. Elle économisera une partie des bénéfices générés par ce crédit dans son activité pour augmenter le matériel et le reste lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Agathe is a 45-year-old married woman, and the mother of five children between the ages of 13 and 25.  Two of her children are still in school, and she also has two other dependents. She is a seamstress and has been running her sewing workshop for three years.  There, she sews school bags in a district of the capital. Her business earns more revenue during the beginning of the school year because the bags are an important tool for the students.

Agathe is asking for a loan in order to buy a bolt of fabric and sewing materials for making school bags.  This will allow her to increase production, and therefore her sales and income.  She will save a portion of the income generated by this loan to invest in more supplies, and the rest will allow her to provide for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a bolt of fabric and sewing supplies

loans.name: Rene Bartolo

texts.es:
RENE TIENE 31 AÑOS ES CASADO TIENE UN HIJO Y VIVE CON LA ESPOSA EN UN DEPARTAMENTO ARRENDADO.

EL SE DEDICA A LA AGRICULTURA A LA SIEMBRA DE MAIZ EN TERRENOS ARRENDADO, RENE NECESITA EL DINERO PARA INVERTIR EN ABONOS Y FERTILIZANTES EL DIENRO LE AYUDADO A INVERTIR EN EL MAIZ Y A PAGAR A LOS SEÑORES QUE LE AYUDAN CON EL TRABAJO.

EL SUEÑO DE RENE ES TRABAJAR MAS PARA TENER DINERO PARA COMPRAR UNA CASA Y UN CARRO

EN LOS TIEMPOS LIBRES LE GUSTA HACER DEPORTE Y DESCANSAR.
texts.en: René, 31, is married and has a son; he lives with his wife in a rented apartment.  He works in agriculture; he grows corn on leased land.  René needs the money to buy manure and fertilizer.  The money will help him invest in the corn and to pay the men who help him do the work.  René’s dream is to work more to have money to buy a house and a car.  He likes to play sports and to rest in his free time.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Najma

texts.en:
Najma lives in Likoni area of Coast province. She is a married mother of three. For the past two years, Najma has operated a cosmetics shop where she also sells clothes and sanitary pads. She started the business with her own little savings. Najma learned about Milango through a friend who invited her to the group and she joined to access credit to improve her business operations. Najma's major business challenges are high transport and fuel costs, purchasing stock, and finding customers.

Najma is requesting a 21,050 KES loan to purchase hair pieces, lotions, perfumes and other items. She will use the extra income from her loan to add to her savings and expand her business as well as for personal use. In the future, Najma plans to open retail shops.

loans.use: to purchase hair pieces, lotions, perfumes, and other items

loans.name: Haskel

texts.en: Haskel lives in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married, has one child and owns a cereal shop which he has been operating for the last four years. He learned about Milango from friends who invited him to our group, and he joined as a way to access credit to improve his business operations. His main challenges are price fluctuations, inflation and buying items to sell. He is applying for a loan for 41,850 Kenyan shillings to buy maize, beans, peas and wheat in bulk. He will use the extra income made possible by this loan, along with his savings, to pay school fees for his child. His dream is to open a retail shop.

loans.use: to buy maize, beans, peas and wheat in bulk to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Yesica Marilu

texts.es: Yesica, tiene 27 años de edad, es casada, tiene 2 hijos y vive en el municipio de Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara junto a su esposo, hijos y su madre. Hace 4 años que Yesica, decidió establecer su propio negocio donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar, como ser: refrescos, pan, azúcar, manteca, harina, verduras, cereales, condimentos etc. con este negocio cubre muchos gastos del hogar y complementa los ingresos familiares. Con el préstamo que solicita por 10,000 Lempiras, va suplir la demanda de sus clientes ya que va comprar carnes y embutidos, que no tiene en existencia y lograra aumentar las ventas y las ganancias. Sus planes son comprar una casa ya que donde vive es de su madre , y va seguir apoyando a sus hijos con el estudio.
texts.en:
Yesica, 27, is married and has two children.  She lives in the municipality of Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara with her husband, children and her mother.  Four years ago Yesica decided to start her own business where she sells basic staples like soft-drinks, bread, sugar, lard, flour, vegetables, cereals, condiments, etc.  She covers many household expenses and contributes to family income by means of this business.  

With the 10,000 Lempira loan she’s requesting she will meet customer demand because she is going to buy meat and canned goods that she’s out of thus increasing sales and profits.  Her plan is to buy a house because the one she lives in is her mother’s and to continue supporting her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy meat and canned goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy material, sewing thread, and pins

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice lives in the Kilifi area of Coast province, Kenya. She is married and has four children, two of whom attend school. For the past year, Beatrice has operated a cafe. She learned about Milango through a friend who invited her to the group and she joined to access credit to improve her business operations. Beatrice's main business challenges are competition and lack of funds.

Beatrice is reqesting a 21,100 KES loan to buy cooking oil, maize flour, cereals, and wheat flour. She will use her extra income to add to her savings and improve the living standard of her family. In the future, Beatrice hopes to expand her business to a bigger location than where she is now.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, maize flour, cereals, and wheat flour

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: LA SRA. MARIA ES VIUDA, TIENE 59 AÑOS DE EDAD. ACTUALMENTE OBTIENE INGRESOS A TRAVES DE SU PENSION QUE RECIBE CADA MES. ELLA VIVE SOLA EN SU CASA,LA CUAL HA CUIDADO Y MANTENIDO DESDE HACE YA MAS DE 20 AÑOS. RECIENTEMENTE LA SRA. MARIA VIO UNA PROBLEMATICA EN SU CASA, EL TECHO Y UNA PEQUEÑA PARTE DE LA PARED EMPEZARON A MOSTRAR PEQUEÑAS GRIETAS QUE PUEDEN CAUSAR HUMEDAD EN LA CASA. POR ESTA RAZON LA SRA MARIA SOLICITO UN PRESTAMO CON EL CUAL EXPRESA QUE REALIZARA LA IMPERMEABILIZACION DE SU CASA Y TAMBIEN CUBRIRA LAS GRIETAS QUE SE PRESENTAN EN SU TECHO PARA MANTENER SU CASA EN BUEN ESTADO.
texts.en: Maria is a widow. She is 59 years old. Currently she receives income through her pension each month. She lives alone in her house, which she has cared for and maintained for over 20 years. Recently Maria saw a problem in her house. The ceiling and a small part of the wall started to show small cracks that could cause dampness in the house. For this reason, Maria is asking for a loan with which she says she will waterproof her house and also cover the cracks in her ceiling in order to maintain her house in good condition.

loans.use: to waterproof her ceiling and cover cracks

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es:
Rosa reside en el departamento de Masaya, tiene la edad de 42 años, casada, su núcleo familiar es de 2 ella y su esposo, ya que sus hijos trabajan de forma independiente.
 Su oficio es la elaboración de hamacas artesanales hechas a base de manila. Anteriormente ella era la que le ayudaba a su esposo en el negocio, pero a raíz que el esposo cayo en cama hace tres años atrás, esto debido a un cáncer que le detectaron en el cerebro, ella decidió tomar las riendas del negocio porque también requería pagar los gastos de los medicamentos que tenia que realizar por la enfermedad de su esposo, de las quimioterapias.

 Doña Rosa nos comenta que su esposo sigue con la enfermedad ya que a veces se recupera y después vuelve a recaer, pero ella dice que con la ayuda de Dios todo es posible y que seguirá en la lucha hasta que Dios se lo permita al lado de su esposo, y seguirá trabajando en su negocio ya que es el único medio que le ha permitido sufragar los gastos. Le esta muy agradecida a nuestra Institución Ceprodel por darle la facilidad de obtener un crédito que le permita comprar la materia prima para cumplir con pedidos.
 Es por eso que se presenta a nuestras oficinas para solicitar un nuevo crédito para la compra de 3 bolsas de hilo (especificar para que se usan), retorcido, (significado) 10 playeras (para que utilizan este). Ya que tiene sus propios clientes a los cuales les distribuye y que están ubicados en el sector de artesanía del mercado y también cuenta con un pequeño puesto a orilla de la carretera cerca de su casa.
texts.en:
Rosa resides in the Department of Masaya, is 42 years old and married. Her nuclear family consists of just 2, herself and her husband, now that her children work independently.

Her skill is making artisan hammocks, using Manila cord. Previously, she helped her husband in the business, but since he became bed-ridden some 3 years ago, due to brain cancer, she decided to take on the reigns of the business. She would need to pay for the medicine he required and the chemotherapy.

Rosa reports that her husband continues to be ill, though at times he recuperates, then falls ill again. But she says that with God's help, all is possible and the struggle will continue so long as God allows her to be at her husband's side. Rosa will continue working in her business, since it is the only means she has of covering the costs. She is very grateful to Ceprodel for facilitating a loan that will permit her to buy the primary materials required to fill customer orders.

That is why Rosa has visited our offices, to solicit a new loan to buy 3 sacks of thread (specifically those she uses), twists (for hook supports), and 10 beach chair frames (that will also require these materials). She now has her own customers who buy her products from her location in the artisan sector of the market. Rosa can also count on a small post alongside the highway near her house.

loans.use: buy 3 sacks of thread (Manila, to make hammocks), twists ( hooks where thread is woven together to provide more support), and 10 beach chairs ('hammocks' in the form of personal seats).

loans.name: Marcia Gioconda

texts.es:
Marcia Gioconda tiene 25 años, es soltera vive con la mamá tiene un hijo de 8 meses de edad. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama VRC SAN FRANCISCO DE SIBIMBE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Sibimbe, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta  ventanilla tiene 20socio los cuales se dedican a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembran maíz y arroz.

Marcia Gioconda se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz en terrenos de propiedad de la madre pero trabajan juntas en la agricultura. Las compras y las ventas los hace en la ciudad de ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, urea, líquido mata monte y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para los cultivos. Enfrentar desafíos como plagas que atacan a los cultivos cómo el cogollero y el ratón. El sueño es ayudar economicaente a la madre y salir adelante con el hijo.
Le gusta leer y escuchar música.
texts.en:
Marcia Gioconda is 25 years old, unmarried and lives with her mother. She has an 8-month-old son and lives in Ventanas canton in Los Rios Province.

Her communal bank is called San Francisco de Sibimbe and is located in Sibimbe precinct in Ventanas canton. It has 20 members who are dedicated to short cycle farming of maize and rice.

Marcia Gioconda cultivates maize and rice on land owned by her mother, however the two farm together. She makes her purchases and sales in the city of Ventanas. She is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, urea, liquid weed killer and compost. With help from the loan she will be able to buy what is necessary for her plants and confront the challenges that attack them, the pests such as budworms and rats. Her dream is to help her mother financially and to get ahead with her son. She enjoys reading and listening to music.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, urea, liquid weed killer and compost.

loans.name: Jose Alberto

texts.es: EL SR. JOSE TIENE 49 AÑOS DE EDAD, VIVE SOLO EN SU CASA, LA CUAL ADQUIRIO CON ESFUERZO HACE YA MAS DE 20 AÑOS. EL TRABAJA EN UNA EMPRESA DE TRASNPORTES DE PERSONAL DESDE HACE YA VARIOS AÑOS. OCUPA LA MAYOR PARTE DE SU TIEMPO EN SU TRABAJO Y EN EL MANTENIMIENTO DE SU CASA. ACTUALMENTE ESTA REALIZANDO CAMBIOS EN EL INTERIOR DE SU DOMICILIO, ESPECIFICAMENTE EN LA COCINA. EL DESEA REALIZAR LA DIVISION DEL ESPACIO DE LA SALA Y LA COCINA CON UNA PEQUEÑA PARED DE MADERA QUE LE PERMITA DAR UNA MEJOR VISTA AL INTERIOR DE SU CASA.
texts.en: José, 49, lives alone in his house that he acquired with much effort more than 20 years ago.  He has been employed in a personnel transportation firm for several years now.  He spends most of his time at work and in keeping up his house.  He’s currently remodeling the interior of his house, specifically the kitchen.  He wants to install a small wood wall to separate the living room from the kitchen so that the interior of his house will have a better appearance.

loans.use: to complete the kitchen and dining room interior.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo, 35, has been selling food for seven years. This has become her main source of income to cover expenses for her home, her husband and four children. She has managed to keep her market share because she’s kept up-to-date through courses where she acquires technical skills to compete in the market by applying better techniques on her customers. Her main customers are employees of firms.

She works every day, Monday through Sunday, and is inspired by her drive to see her children become successful professionals in the future. Her growth plan starts with the sale of products in larger amounts. This is precisely why she’s calling on a Kiva loan, her third financing from Yehu, to buy more vegetables and sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.es:
Teodoro, es habitante de la comarca llamada Cerro La Corona, en las afueras de Boaco,  el es agricultor, cultiva maíz, frijol y trigo oficio que aprendió junto a su padre  desde que tenía 12 años, a los 20 años se caso y empezó a hacer sus propias huertas y los gastos los cubría con dinero que ganaba del trabajo que realizaba como jornalero. En la actualidad ha comprado sus vacas y tierras  que lo ha obtenido de los ingresos que le deja la cosecha. En su huerta lo apoyan sus hijos y trabajadores a quienes les paga, económicamente también recibe el apoyo de unos de sus hijos el cual se dedica a la enseñanza en una de las escuelas de la comunidad, cuando don Teodoro  saca su cosecha la lleva a vender a Managua ya que afirma que le pagan muy bien sus productos, pero esta solicitando este crédito para compra de insumos y pagar mano de obra para hacer huerta para el siguiente ciclo de siembra que pronto iniciara. El nos cuenta que este crédito le será de gran ayuda por que podrá seguir trabajando en la huerta  y terminar de cubrir los costos de producción. 
Asegura que cuando termine de pagar este crédito , le gustaría comprar unas vaquillas.
texts.en:
Teodoro lives in the region of Cerro La Corona, on the outskirts of Boaco. He is a farmer and cultivates corn, beans, and wheat. He learned this trade from his father beginning when he was 12 years old. When he was 20 years old, Teodoro got married and began to work his own farms. He covered the costs using money he earned by working as a day laborer.

Teodoro has purchased his cows and land with the money earned from the harvest. His children and other workers help out on the farm and Teodoro pays them both economically and in the form of education, since one of his sons teaches at a school in the community. When the harvest is ready, Teodoro takes the products to Managua and sells them for what he assures is a very good price. 

Teodoro is requesting this loan in order to purchase inputs and pay for labor for the next cycle of harvest on his farm, which will begin soon. This loan will be a big help to him because it will allow him to continue working in the farm and finish paying off the costs of production. When he finishes repaying this loan, he would like to buy some young cows.

loans.use: to purchase inputs and pay for labor for his farm.

loans.name: Lourdes Yamileth

texts.es:
Lourdes, tiene 34 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos, y vive en el municipio de Macuelizo Santa Bárbara con sus hijos y sus padres.
Hace 8 años que Lourdes comenzó a vender mercadería nueva y usada y ha crecido en su negocio, ella vende en su casa y también de manera ambulante. Ya tiene su clientela en su barrio. Ofrece blusas, pantalones para caballeros, sandalias, zapatos, camisas, pantalones cortos y ropa de niños. Necesita comprar otros productos como gorras, fajas, sandalias y otros para incrementar su inventario y sus ventas, para eso solicita un préstamo por 10,000 Lempiras. Espera obtener más ganancias para sostener a su familia. Su meta es graduar a sus hijos en la universidad y acondicionar mejor el negocio.
texts.en: Lourdes, 34, is a single mother; she has three children and lives in the town of Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara with her children and her parents.  She started selling new and used merchandise 8 years ago and the business has been growing.  She sells at home and also from place to place.  She has regular customers in the neighborhood.  She sells blouses, men’s pants, sandals, shoes, shirts, shorts and children’s clothes.  She needs to buy other merchandise like caps, belts, sandals and others to increase her inventory and sales which is why she’s asking for a 10,000 Lempira loan.  She hopes to earn higher profits to support her family.  Her children is to see her children graduate from university and to better equip her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es:
El Comité "Primavera" tiene 11 integrantes y se encuentra en su 1° ciclo, a todas se las ve entusiasmadas y con ganas de trabajar con más empeño y dedicación dentro de sus distintas actividades para poder llegar a los objetivos tanto conjunta como separadamente.
La sra. Lorena, una de las integrantes del grupo, se dedica a la venta de lencerías, con esta actividad ella logra mantener a su familia aunque igualmente acrecentar el negocio le haría tener una vida aún mejor.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de lencerías como sostenes, camisolines, corpiños, para la posterior venta de estos.
texts.en:
The “Primavera” (Spring) committee has 11 members and is in its first cycle.  All of them are excited and ready to work harder and with more dedication within their various activities to be able to reach both their individual and their group goals.

Lorena is one of the group members.  She sells lingerie and by means of this activity is able to support her family although expanding the business would mean a still better life.  She’s asking for the loan to buy lingerie like bras, teddies and bustiers for subsequent sale.

loans.use: to buy lingerie.

loans.name: Eddy Gabriel

texts.es: Eddy, es un joven, soltero, de 22 años de edad, originario de Camoapa municipio de Boaco. El se dedica desde muy pequeño a trabajar en las labores del campo junto con su padre, siembra granos básicos como maíz, frijol, trigo y también se dedica a la crianza de ganado, además el estudia Ingeniería Civil, el paga sus estudios con las ganancias que le deja la venta de su cosechas y de los terneros.  También aporta para ayudar a pagar los gastos de su casa. Uno de sus proyectos es lo tener su propia finca y tener ganado de producción de leche y lograr finalizar sus estudios para enorgullecer a su papa. El está solicitando el crédito para comprar 2 terneros.
texts.en: Eddy, 22, is a young, single man from Camoapa in Boaco Municipality.  He has worked since he was very little doing work in the fields alongside his father.  He grows basic grains like corn, beans and wheat and he also raises cattle.  In addition, he’s studying civil engineering.  He pays for his studies with profits he earns selling his crops and his calves.  He also helps to pay household expenses.  One of his projects is to have his own farm and to have dairy cattle and also to complete his studies to make his father proud.  He’s asking for the loan to buy two calves.

loans.use: to buy two calves.

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma lives in the Kongowea area of Coast province, Kenya. He is married. For the past year, Juma has operated a clothing business and he also earns a salary from other employment. He learned about Milango through a friend who invited him to the group and he joined to access credit to improve his business operations. Juma's business challenges are low profits during the low season and bad debts.

Juma is requesting a 52,250 KES loan to buy gentlemen and ladies clothing to sell. He will use the extra income from his loan to add to his savings and improve the living standard of her family. In the future, Juma plans to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Activas, tiene 12 integrantes, es un grupo unido y capáz de realizar actividades conjuntamente que fortalecen su compañerismo.
La sra. Griselda, una de las integrantes del grupo, se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, con esta actividad ella aporta a su canasta familiar, desea poder ofrecer mayor variedad de frutas y verduras a su clientela, tener mas mercaderías y generar mayor ingreso.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de variedades de frutas y verduras.
texts.en:
The committee named “Mujeres Activas” (Active Women) has 12 members. It is a close-knit and capable group that works together on activities in order to strengthen the camaraderie among its members.

Sra. Griselda is one of the members of this group. She sells fruits and vegetables, which helps her to feed her family. Griselda wants to offer a wider variety of fruits and vegetables to her customers, so she hopes to have more merchandise and generate more income as a result. She is requesting a loan so that she can buy a variety of fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.
